description:
My friend and I strolled in on a sunny Friday afternoon to pick up food before heading to Dolo, and boy was that the best decision ever!
We both got super nachos (aka the perfect sunny day in the park food!). I got mine with grilled shrimp and she got hers with carne asada.
We both got the works - sour cream, avo, beans, rice, lettuce, jalapenos, salsas...plus horchatas!

The chips were fresh - you can see them frying them right behind the counter, and my shrimp were grilled to a smokey perfection. Super authentic flavors and cheap quick eats. What more do you want from a corner taqueria?! Definitely will be back :)
author: Farrah N.

description:
I am having trouble even writing this review, because it is reminding me that I wish I was here everyday of my life. I can't stop thinking about that Super Burrito that I had and literally all the flavors and sauces and chips and omg. 

I knew I wanted to grab food in the Mission but I had no idea I would potentially have one of the best burritos I've ever had in my life...when I bit into it I knew things were going to change forever. 

I got the carne asada super burrito with everything in it and that came with some chips on the size as well. I rinsed it all down with an authentic Apple Soda from their drink cooler (which has cold ones as well). 

The line outside the spot was kind of crazy but seriously worth the wait and I encourage anyone who sees line and is debating going to stick it out.
author: Isaiah W.

description:
Wow! I ordered the Taco, Enchilada, and Tamale combination dinner. It was reasonably priced and it was excellent! Lots of food, no scrimping here! The salsa was fresh and bursting with flavor.
The atmosphere is basic, so don't come for a restaurant experience. Just come hungry and enjoy the food. I came nearly closing on a Wednesday night so wasn't sure what to expect, but was more than pleasantly surprised. They also had a couple of churros which I have been hunting for a place to pick one up occasionally on my travels... I'll be coming back earlier to see how good they are fresh, but hey, fried dough, cinnamon and sugar is good regardless...
I hope you enjoy this place as much as I did!
author: Steve S.

description: MMM MMM, this spot has excellent tacos and chips.  We stopped by here yesterday and ordered a crap load of tacos, I think super tacos. As for the meats, the carnitas was nice and crisped on the outside and their carne asada was pretty moist.  Unfortunately we didn't discover their hot salsas until the very end, but the red one was good.  My coworker says their green sauce is of the best in California.  Just a note that the super tacos are too stuffed to pick up with your hands, you pretty much need a fork.  Ooo the tortillas they use for the tacos have excellent texture. Would recommend this spot for sure.
author: Spencer W.

description:
One of my favorite Taqueria's in the Bay Area 
I love the carne asada  burrito has chunks of the fresh avocado inside and taste great with their home made salsa.:)
author: Daniel P.

description:
No.
there are so many better Taquerias in San Francisco than this place.
my super burrito carne asada was pale, flavorless, and hella bland.
I walked by this place numerous times and been thinking about trying it for a while.
now, I know for sure ..
No es Buen Sabor para Mi.
author: Rudy H.

description:
This place doesn't look great from the outside but don't judge a book by its cover. 

I had a single el pastor taco and it was darn good.

Throw in super friendly service , cheap prices and they take plastic and you got yourself a fan ( 4 stars).

Huge servings of meat as well, and the flavor was pretty tasty ( slightly above average I'd say) .

The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.  

Rod's SF Taco Rankings:

1 El Gallo Giro Taco truck
2 Garajito
3 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
4 La Corneta
5 Chisme
6 El Norteno Taco Truck
7 Taqueria Los Mayas 
8 Garaje
9 Taqueria Vallarta
10 Little Taqueria
11 La Taqueria
12 Taqueria Castillo
13 El Farolito
14 Pancho Villa Taqueria 
15 Taqueria el Buen Sabor
16 Panuchos
17 Taqueria Gudalajara
18 La Palma Mexicatessen
19 El Tonayense
20 Tropisueno
21 La Espiga de Oro
22 Papito Hayes
23 Tacos San Buena
24 Los Compadres Taco Truck
25 Cochinita Mayan Cuisine
26 El Taco Loco
27 Gordo Taqueria
28 Nick's Crispy Tacos

Below is my top 10 for the Bay Area in case you were curious.
1 El Gallo Giro Taco truck
2 El Jaliciense
3 Taqueria Sinaloa
4 Garajito
5 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
6 Belly
7 La Corneta
8 Chisme
9 El Norteno Taco Truck
10 Taqueria Los Mayas
author: Rod M.

description:
This place is my nee favorite spot in SFO. After looking long and wide for a good taqueria that has amazing flavors and heart in its food I am glad that a friend brought me to this place. The menu is pretty standard but the food is where this place stands out.

The servers make sure that everything is explained thoroughly. In fact, they will tell you ingredients and taste of some of the elements if you ask.  We ordered a steak quesadilla, a chicken dinner, and nachos. For me the nachos were the winner of the nite! 

The attendant first made a layer of chips, then poured cheese and refrito over them. She proceeded to put another layer of chips and then topped it with everything: crema, guacamole, and the meat. I was so grateful that she allowed me a mixed meat platter, it truly made my day. She also didn't was generous on the chicken and steak, which was awesome. This type of attitude is what other  businesses should emulate: Friendliness, good taste, great portions. I LOVE EL BUEN SABOR!

We actually came back today in hopes of finding our favorite dish: pollo asado.
author: Emmanuel T.

description:
Tried this place out while my favorite burrito place in the Mission is being renovated, really enjoyed it! Got a super burrito for about 10 bucks which was delicious. Loved that they put a little lettuce, made it taste slightly healthier. Meat was full of flavor and the burrito was a good size. Friend got the nachos and loved them! Service was a little slow, but they were super busy on Saturday night, so I get it. And they were really friendly which was nice. Also nice, they take credit cards!!!

Overall, a solid place. I'd go back!
author: Erin H.

description: Okay taqueria in the Mission district. Stopped by with a group of friends for a quick bite for lunch. I ordered their carne asada super burrito ($9) which was packed with carne asada beef, beans, rice, cabbage, tomatoes, guacamole, and a ton of sauce. The burrito was decent -- the meat had a good amount of flavor, but there was too much sauce and I felt it was overall heavy. Good size for the price, though.
author: Alvin W.

description:
Taqueria el Buen Sabor is a high holy queen in the Mission.  

Everything is flavored beautifully and the portions are generous.  Additionally, the prices are on point.  I HIGHLY recommend the chile verde chicken or pork, they're both tender, juicy and perfectly seasoned.  

The only downside I can think of is the line that can form at all parts of the day.  Thankfully, the service is quick, friendly and attentive.
author: Marilyn F.

description:
If your in the neighborhood and want a burrito then it's an okay spot but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there so don't let the line fool you, it's just a very small restaurant.
The food is decent and the workers are fast but I would recommend the next taqueria a couple blocks up toward the bart station.
author: Sandy S.

description:
The breakfast burrito with no meat is basically two eggs with a ton of rice, some beans, and light cheese.  Same price with or without meat and no subbing veggies or avocado without an up charge. I would not recommend this place when there's many better options nearby. 

No parking
author: Mikey R.

description: I swung by here two weeks ago and was delighted with the overstuffed tacos I got: one shrimp and one veg (without onion or rice). Served with tortilla chips. For less than a tenner, I left stuffed. They aren't the best tacos I've ever had but definitely delicious: fat, juicy shrimp (and a couple of them to boot) and lots of veg toppings on both. Also love that the establishment composts and recycles.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Buen Sabor is definitely one of my favorite taquerias in the city, and one that is quickly becoming a 'must go' every time I come back here from New York.

My original favorite was Taqueria Can-Cun, but I think I'm settling on only liking that place for its wet burritos. In any other situation I think I like the quality of the product at Buen Sabor better.

I order the carnitas super burrito here. This is a dish I only otherwise order at my absolute favorite place, which is Taqueria la Bamba on Rengstorff Ave in Mountain View. It's a super well constructed and flavorful burrito!

It's a perfect place to order for pickup while your friends sit at a nearby bar, and then go and fetch the food for everyone once it's ready. Everyone loves you for this and will buy you a round, everyone gets to enjoy delicious burritos. Win win situation.
author: Josh K.

description: Super nachos with asada!!! Doooo it!!! Best place I've had super nachos at. Loaded with melted cheese, sour cream, guacamole, and pico de gallo in just the right amount. Huge and easily shared for 2.
author: Anna N.

description:
Soggy tortilla and lady was rude. 

Doesn't live up to the name as I wouldn't say the food was flavorful. Tacos were different with beans on them.
author: Ashley M.

description:
If you're hungry, this is INCREDIBLE Mexican food! Huge portions and super tasty. Bonus for vegetarians: the beans are lard-free!

Intimate place and authentic as well. I highly recommend the veggie quesadilla and the horchata. 

My friends recommend:
Shrimp quesadilla
Carne Asada burrito
Super veg burrito (not as spicy as desired)
Carne asada torta
author: Ria J.

description:
Love this place. High quality food.  The ladies run a tight solid family operation. The quality and care in preparing the food is evident. I love their shrimp tacos, nachos are excellent, burrito bowls are legit. Salsa options are limited  to red and green but again better to have high quality delicious salsa than more options at lower quality like some taquerias (won't mention any names).  

I love this spot, it's neighborhood gem and I highly recommend it. You will not be disappointed.
author: Reena T.

description: These tacos, the beans, the rice, the tamales, the salsa - everything is on point here! Definitely recommend a stop on.
author: Kim S.

description:
THIS is what a taco joint should be! Moist well seasoned meat without being greasy, grilled tortillas that hold together, simple traditional assembly. No frills, all about the food. 

I asked my cousin to take me to a local favorite, nothing fancy, but good food and he delivered. 

Great prices too, and right in the middle of everything!
author: Sarah F.

description:
I've been coming here since I was a kid, around 7-10 years old. I'm currently 23 now, and this still remains in my opinion the best taqueria in SF. No other place compares in my opinion. Their steak is unbelievable, well cooked, and has great flavour. In a way, this place will spoil you. Once you try their steak either in a burrito or on a plate, you'll be left wanting when you buy competition at other places nearby. Their burritos are well priced and a very nice big size. The steak texture is just incredible and its cooked to perfection. They also have some really wonderful vegetarian options. If I had to pick my 3 favourite items on the menu it would be the steak dinner plate, special burrito, and the vegetarian burrito for when you don't want something so heavy. $5.50 for beans, cheese and rice beautifully wrapped up and it fills you up.

The service is fast, and this place gets packed on the weekends with lines going out the door. They've also been upgrading their systems over the years and currently use some really nice new cashier equipment to get you checked out very quickly. You can tell a lot of love goes into this business, and all the workers and owners band together to give you the best experience possible and accommodate customer's needs.

I've been coming here for over a decade for good reason, and hope to keep coming here for decades more if possible. The food is so well priced and so good here that its become a normal part of my diet for myself and my family every few weeks. Now my younger siblings come here and continue the tradition.
author: Jeffrey F.

description: This is a really good corner taqueria. The meats are really fresh and they really do care about how your food is presented. The woman taking the orders is very fast efficient and friendly. They accept credit cards which is a plus since most taquerias are cash based. It might take a little time to order over the phone since they are busy but she makes sure your order is accurate before hanging up. The worst part though is the parking. It honestly is the busiest part of the Mission and can take a very long time to find parking. I suggest taking someone with you that way they can run down while you circle the block.
author: Em D.

description:
A small unassuming restaurant in the heart of Mission district in San Francisco was a perfect place for a late lunch on a beautiful mild day in the city. The small restaurant was decorated with paintings on the walls with versions sceneries.

The restaurant was half full as we checked in around 3:00PM. Ordered fish tacos, their special taco, and steak quesadilla for the 3 of us it was under $20!!! (Cash Only) the staff working behind the counter taking orders and serving food were most pleasant and helpful. 

The food was just delicious. Everything we had tasted fresh with a delicate flavor with generous portion. Just loved it, will be back...
author: Mehrnaz H.

description: Before this got popular, I used to come wallow in my teacher struggles on some good ass burritos -- highly recommend it for therapy and everything on the menu
author: J C.

description: Carne asada meat was dry.  Al pastor was nicely stewed in its sauce.  3$ per taco isn't bad. Not cheap but not expensive.  I still like pancha villa.
author: Fatty A.

description: Best vegan / vegetarian burrito in town! This is coming from an SF native. They have not only marinated tofu, but a "veg. California" burrito with tofu, salsa, mushroom, bell pepper, zucchini, broccoli, rice, and beans! Add guac for that extra good good. When I ate meat, El Farolito was always the spot, but I'm definitely disappointed in most of the city's authentic taquerias veg options. Vegetarians and vegans, go here!! You won't be disappointed.
author: Becca C.

description: Don't let the rough looking exterior fool you, the food here is damn good and plentiful.  Great friendly employees serve it up quick and don't mind if it's your first time there.  Looking forward to going back the next time I'm in town.
author: Matt T.

description:
Caught a show at The Chapel the other night and saw that this place was open until 10:30pm so I made sure to get in an order before then.

These burritos are tasty!  Even though they scoop the pre-cooked meat from a stainless steel container, I have to say it was pretty damn good still.  Good proportions in every bite and a nice combination of seasonings.

A salsa bar is non-existent, but you can ask the cashier to get you a few extra pico de gallos and tomatillo sauces.

I'm definitely coming back here next time I'm catching a show!
author: John M.

description: Solid classic mission district taco spot with super cold mexican beers. Walk up service the "taco" is more like a full plate of food. Cheers!
author: Seth W.

description:
Walked to Valencia from 24th St. BART.
Walked another 6 blocks before I found a taqueria.
A little shocked...what is this the mission?

Ordered...Vegetariano California Burrito.
They sauteed the veggies as I watched.  
Fresh broccoli, zucchini, mushrooms, green peppers, onions, and tofu; in addition to the usual beans, rice, and salsa. 

Mild seasoning allowed me to enjoy the veggies' flavor.
Enjoyed the whole burrito.
.
author: Saul M.

description:
What you need to know: 
- This is my FAVORITE taqueria in the Mission, possibly in the entire United States! This should have snagged the best burrito award in America! 
- Their carnitas (roasted pork) is what keeps me coming back again and again! It is expertly cooked so that it is succulent, juicy and not greasy.  Everyone else fails at cooking carnitas and it comes out dry. 
- I always get the carnitas super burrito with refried beans - it's like tasting heaven. 
- Fast and friendly service! They have a small dining area, but be warned, don't use their bathroom unless you're desperate. 

What I ordered: 
- Carnitas super burrito $8.75 - Super burrito comes with meat of choice, rice, beans, cheese, guacamole, lettuce, sour cream and tomato. All the flavors, the contrast of textures, the juiciness of the carnitas make this my dream burrito come true! 
- Carne asada (charbroiled steak) special burrito $8.25 - Special burrito comes with meat of choice, rice, beans cheese, and guacamole. The carne asada had a lovely smokiness to it and was firm yet tender.
author: Karen L.

description:
Best Taco's in SF! and that's coming from someone who spent 11 years living in Southern California. Line can be long, but it is worth the wait.  

TIP: If you order on Eat24, you have to go straight to the register right away and let them know you are there so they will make your food.
author: Prescious S.

description:
I wanted to go to El Toro but my friend said this is the best burrito.  Well I didn't get a burrito but three carnitas crispy tacos and I wasn't that impressed.

When at an authentic taqueria I'm used to soft tacos that are usually warmed on a grill and was surprised to see them put my carnitas on the grill to warm it up.  

The amount of meat for three tacos is probably the amount they use for one taco at an authentic taqueria and at 2.85 per taco felt a little ripped off.

To top it off, my friend who insisted I tried this place didn't even order anything.
author: James H.

description: This is a very simple, no frills Taqueria which is a few steps away from Tacolicious. do they provide an amazing atomosphere? No. Do they provide alcoholic beverages? No. Do they offer fusion tacos and burrotos? No. What they do is non greasy, packed with flavor and meat and no frill environment for a reasonable cost. It wont break your bank to eat here. I had the crunchy taco and a pulled pork taco. Both were very well seasoned and tasted good. You have an option of choosing black or pinto beans. Of course you can make it supreme or more than supreme depending on how heavy you like your burrito, taco to be.
author: Kartik P.

description:
Solid taqueria on the 16th-street-side of Mission. I ordered one Everything Taco with Al Pastor. IT WAS HUGE. It was about 3pm and I was thinking "okay, I'll just order one to keep me going till dinner"....well needless to say, that practically was my dinner. One taco took up about 2/3 of the plate with all the yummy toppings - definitely bang for your buck. 

The Al Pastor was a bit greasy (not too much, just right - definitely not dry) but very flavorful, and the toppings were all fresh and flavorful. Like someone else mentioned, this place is not stingy with their salsas, which is awesome. I was also offered chips on the side. The chips are made fresh in house.

If I'm ever in the neighborhood, I'll definitely be back!
author: Amanda R.

description: These burriots really hit the spot... however, salsa is weak. Where are the spices, where is kick, where is the pazazz. Fresh ingredients, filling burrito, but no spice. 4/5.
author: David J.

description:
AMAZING. Landed here randomly and we were pleasantly surprised. All 5 of my friends ate until we couldn't move and enjoyed every second of it. They are now in food comas, and need a belly rub. A+++


Came back here again. And it was even better. I am so happy every time I come here
author: Ross S.

description: Tried the taco salad and added beans and rice plus the usual salsa lettuce sour cream guacamole and cheese. Personally asked for the spiciest salsa they have, but it was very mild. Quick service, friendly people. The water was out of cups though and they need to step up the heat game!
author: Kara N.

description:
Must I say that the first time I visited this place I got 2 carne arsada soft tacos and 1 regular crispy taco and it changed my life. I definitely love their steak here and they also give you chips as a side. Even if you only order 1 taco for $2.60! I mean, who does that anymore? 

I've visited La Taqueria and their burrito didn't even compare. I think the burrito here is far superior for a way cheaper price and the line isn't nearly as bad. I truly am a loyal customer here now and would not go anywhere else for Mexican food and I really don't say that about a lot of places so I definitely recommend checking this place out. I think their burritos are only $7 and some change.
author: My N.

description:
This place can seriously compete with some of the other heavy hitters on Valencia street. After a long day at Dolores or just a long day in general, this food will seriously fuel your soul. Your soulllll!!! I always get their super tacos (3.50 each) or a super burrito and I'm not freaking breaking my wallet for a change for quality meet and a good amount of guacamole. Their guacamole does need some lime, but in general, their food is quality and they serve it super fast! Pair this with their 3 dollar beers and you are set to go crazy for the rest of the day!!! 

And also I really appreciated that the woman at the counter had to have 2 other people look at my ID to make sure it's real.   She even tried putting a flash light under it! Usually I'd be annoyed for getting my age questioned, but they thought I was 19 and I was seriously flattered. If only movie theatres and swimming pools believed me so I can still get high school price. Thanks again for making me well fed and feeling young!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
Yes. All the yes. Yes to everything I love here: Cheese quesadilla. Vegetarian nachos. Chorizo breakfast burrito. Chicken taquito. Enchiladas. Chile relleno. Green salsa.

Sweet as a peach owner. Lovely counter folks and cooks.

I've been going here for nearly 20 years and have never been disappointed; I think you'll like it, too!
author: Angela G.

description: I guess it took a rainy day for me to try this place out since it wasn't busy. Usually there's a line. Anyway I ordered a special chicken burrito (they put guacamole and cheese). They didn't over stuff the burrito with rice, sour cream, guac, etc. Just the right amount which I think is awesome. It wasn't super greasy either. El Farolito and Pancho Villa are still special to me but I think I found my new favorite taqueria in the area. No frills but still tasty.
author: Gerard Y.

description: I loooove this place. I come maybe 2x a week. It's so delicious!! I always get the special burrito with REFRIED beans, flautas dinner, or taco dinner. Never disappointed!!
author: Karla N.

description:
When discussing dinner options, I texted my friend, "Hecho, Tacorgasmico, or Tacos Club?" to which he replied "Tacolicious?" - I said sure. We walk to Tacolicious and there was a huge line. I asked, "They don't take reservations?" and he said "I don't know, I've never been." - He confused Tacorgasmico and Tacolicious and we walked a mile to find a long wait and a packed restaurant.

So we walked a block and ducked into Taqueria el Buen Sabor. Which was AWESOME. Little hole-in-the-wall inexpensive taqueria that was super-delicious and half the price of Tacolicious. 

This is my new cheap Mexican go-to place, and yes, I'll walk a mile from the Castro for it.
author: Sean B.

description: Not only was the food delish but I left my phone there on a Saturday night didn't realize until I got across the bridge to San Rafael where we live. I called them and they said yes they had it it was safe and not to worry I could come and pick it up the next day/. Thank you soooooooo much for the great food, hard working staff and honesty.  When I brought Alfonso a nice bottle of wine for hanging on to my phone, he was so appreciative and adorable. Thanks again we will be loyal customers from now on.
author: Lori D.

description:
Recommendation: Good Taqueria, I wasn't particularly impressed but I would be willing to try it again!

We stopped here for a quick bite to eat after work last week. I got a super burrito with Carne Asada, black beans, and spicy salsa. I was honestly expecting more of a rush of flavor, but it didn't seem to really do the job for me! It wasn't as spicy as I would have expected and the meat seemed to be bunched up so I only got bites where I could taste the meat every so often. Besides that though, it seemed pretty fine! But I guess that's a rather big part of the meal. I wasn't expecting the burrito to come with chips and salsa, so that was a nice surprise! Also, the cups of water were self service which was very nice, as I typically drink a lot of water when I'm eating. 

As for the interior, it was pretty much jam packed with seating, so we were able to find multiple places to sit down and eat when we came in a little after dinner time. 

I think next time I want to try the nachos, as I caught a couple glimpses of other people ordering them and it looked like it tasted incredible. 

All in all, I think I'll come back here again and try something new. I wasn't blown away by the burrito but it was cheap and they take credit cards, so there's not too much limiting me besides my quest to search for new and exciting restaurants!
author: John B.

description:
3.5 stars. 

Stopped by yesterday 6.11.16. My coworkers and I were hanging out at Dolores Park and got hungry so we decided to look for something to eat. We initially stopped by Bi-Rite Market, but the lines were horrendous and nothing seemed too appetizing. My coworker recommended a nearby taqueria so we stopped by here instead! 

The line wasn't too long, especially after a group of girls freaked out about the $10 CC minimum and left. I had trouble deciding what I wanted to eat. I walked in thinking I shall get a taco, I left with a super burrito. Haha. I opt for the lengua because lengua and cabeza are my meats of choice when I get Mexican food. I didn't see cabeza as an option. My friend got the shrimp quesadilla. Portions are big! I got pretty full 1/4 way into my burrito. Lengua was tender. Burrito wasn't too amazing though. Lacked flavor. Good prices. Probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here in the future.
author: Dianna C.

description: I ordered a super veggie burrito with was roughly priced at a reasonable ~$7.50. There was a decent-sized line through the door, but it moved reasonably quickly (waited ~10-12min for food). Seating was not an issue -- my friend and I were able to grab a couple of seats by the window. They accepted credit cards and it's a pay-at-counter type of deal (after they've assembled/made your order). No salsa bar even though tortilla chips come with the order. We bussed our dishes after the meal and they actually had a compost bin, which was awesome! The burrito was pretty good and it was filling, but I didn't think it was one of the more memorable veggie burritos I've ever had. That being said though, I've heard the meat burritos/tacos are supposed to be good here, so I think I'll go again and try one of those before re-evaluating Buen Sabor.
author: Lucine O.

description: Loveeee eating here. Super close to Dolores Park (walking distance) who doesn't love a view & burritos?
author: Esmie B.

description:
Words cannot describe my love for this place. The burritos are delicious, the salsas coat your tongue in flavor, and the chips add an amazing salty crunch. The prices can't be beat (A super burrito for right around 10 dollars w/ free chips) and the service is amazingly speedy. 

I know there are many taquerias in this neighborhood, but this one holds a special place in my heart. Be warned though, seating is pretty limited. So be prepared to take your burrito to go!
author: Eric L.

description: We came for lunch and it was the best decision. The line didn't take too long and the super v vegetarian burrito was so tasty and filling. The hot sauces added to the tastiness of the filling and we were able to sit in and enjoy a Modelo beer as well. A great experience.
author: Elaine S.

description:
This place ha sheen our favorite for years 
Has really good food and is family owned 
I will recommend this place because it has the best tacos and burritos all their food is really good.
author: Ans C.

description: Imagine your Jewish, Italian, or in my case,  Chinese mom who wants to feed you.  This place can be my Mexican Mom.
author: Leung T.

description: Mmmm. Just when the late night craving was in risk of not being fulfilled this place came and saved the day. I ordered some carne asada nachos. Damn. Just when I thought nachos couldn't get any bigger, the lady at the counter did a double whammy with the beef and beans. I'm like 'whoa'  lol, but let the magic keep happening. It comes with sour cream, cheese, guacamole and love, most importantly. Delicious beef and all the ingredients come together to form a mound of happiness. It may have been the alcohols kicking in but this place was yummy!
author: Natalie M.

description: Great great find. My go-to burrito place in the Mission, even above El Farolito and La Taqueria. Amazing value - I eat a lot and this definitely fills me up - and definitely high quality.
author: Paul B.

description:
One of the best taquerias I have ever eaten at. Been around for as long as I can remember and has become a must-stop place on my visits to SF.

Two weekends ago I brought a group here. Line out the door. Chaos behind the counter. No available tables. But the food is so good, we decided to persist with the confidence that everything would turn out great, as it always has.

The lady behind the counter seemed to be writing down our large order in some form of shorthand, on a small sticky note. I was sure my luck was headed downhill.

Proceeded in the line to the cash register and paid.

Then, like Moses parting the sea, a table opened up and we sat down. Next, they called out my order and they got it right.

And the food.... it's no exaggeration to say not a crumb was left behind.

Delicious. Unpretentious. The best.
author: Rob S.

description:
This place is pretty solid, we came here for a quick bite, I initially wanted to go to taqueria Cancun however we didn't feel like walking an extra .2 of a mile.

We got the burrito special and guacamole with chips.  The burrito special was pretty tasty, we got carne asada for our choice of meat, it got pretty close to el farolito standards but not quite there.  The chips and guacamole were a pretty hefty portion, however it felt as if it lacked flavor, it was still good though.

This place is pretty good, I'd definitely come back for a burrito, if you can make it to el farolito that's still my top pick.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
Overview: Taqueria el Buen Sabor on the corner of 18th and Valencia is probably one of the last non-upscale restaurants on Valencia St in the Mission District and serves small tacos, burritos, nachos, at relatively affordable prices ($2-4/taco, and less than $10 for burritos.)

The Food: I ordered the carnitas and asada tacos without guacamole and was mildly satisfied. The meat was a bit dry, the flavor profile was quite simple, and the corn tortillas were on the small side, and overall I thought it was a simple meal. The table-top green salsa was tasty but I regret not ordering the upgraded taco option that had guac and more veggies. I ended up having an upset stomach for the rest of the day but I cannot be sure that Taqueria el Buen Sabor was to blame as I did dine at several other restaurants the same day.

The Establishment: Kind of dark, not very clean, no fountain drinks or ice machine, disgusting bathroom, but a pretty good amount of seating considering its small size. Only street parking.

The Service: Knowing a bit of Spanish would be helpful here as the employees here definitely have a limited English proficiency. No table service.

Conclusions: Taqueria el Buen Sabor is an authentic, and affordable Mexican restaurant that serves all the traditional Mexican favorites but I both didn't enjoy the cleanliness of the restaurant (specifically the bathroom) and didn't find my meal to be particularly delicious.
author: Andrew H.

description:
My god, so much much better than Pancho Villa (my previous favorite)
First the atmosphere is lively
Second the service is awesome
Third the food is amazing. I recommend the super burrito with lengua as the meat and refried bean.
Last but definitely not least, the cashier was really nice and had a very friendly personality. Jocelyn, it was very nice to meet you XD.
author: Calvin Z.

description:
Mediocre at best, inedible at worst. I've gotten several tacos here. Some of them are fine, a bit bland. My carnitas tacos have been inedible. The carnitas were an overfried mess (see photo).

The nice thing is that they heat up your meat when you order.
author: Meg A.

description: While waiting to eat at a fancy mexican restaurant, decided to check out Taqueria El Buen Sabor and was BLOWN AWAY. Super tasty, affordable and fast! I was visiting SF for a week and ate here 3 times. Save your money and eat here. You won't be disappointed.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
My kid wanted to visit the Mission District a few months ago and part of the plan was to find a "hole-in-the-wall" taqueria - bullseye, Taqueria el Buen Sabor!  

Taqueria el Buen Sabor is what one would expect for a hole-in-the-wall taqueria -  rustic, casual, decent prices and delicious home-style mexican food.

We ordered a variety burritos - shredded chicken, chile verde and vegetarian - all SUPER delicious!

An added bonus was sitting at the heavy wooden table, eating our bounty of tortilla wrapped goodness, watching the "colorful" folks of the Mission District wander in/out.

4 solid stars - can't wait to return!
author: Patrick L.

description: Best taqueria in the city. I'm a native but only discovered it in high school about 13 years ago. The only downside is that if you order online for pickup, they never check the screen and have to make it when you get there. At least you still skip the line! But it gets old...
author: Gabby H.

description:
Solid vegetarian/vegan options for Burritos in the Mission area.  I had this place bookmarked after seeing they offered tofu burritos so after an extra long day in Dolores park and a few beers, mexican was on the mind and this was right around the corner!

A fairly small (a very hot) little taqueria located right in the heart of the mission.  Taqueria el Buen Sabor offers tacos, burritos, and plates for reasonable prices.  I especially enjoy that the vegetarian option is with tofu and grilled veggies (typically 'vegetarian' for the burrito places in town just means rice and beans...). The tofu and veggies were fresh and flavorful.  I went for the refried beans and the combo was delicious.  Free chips and salsa with your order, they offer beer, sodas, and quick/friendly service. Will be back soon
author: Kelsey B.

description: Delicious! One of the better burritos I've had in the Mission and it's close to Dolores Park which is nice as well if you want a quick burrito break.
author: Alexander M.

description: Nothing quite like getting a super burrito and then walking to Dolores with friends. Staff are quick, food is great. Their chicken is seasoned really well and their fish tacos are crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.
author: Tomas R.

description:
I found this place using Yelp and it has good reviews so I decided to try it out during a short lunch break while at a training. 

The carne Assad was much more flavorful than it looked and I'm glad I got it! I ordered two carne Assad tacos, one crunchy and one soft. I was disappointed that the crunchy shell was pre-made, but delicious nonetheless! The line was long, but went very fast and the people behind the counter were nice! I'd definitely come back!
author: Kourtney A.

description:
This place is one of the few remaining authentic Mission Taqueria. 

The carnitas and al pastor items are not to be missed. 

Ask for avocado instead of guacamole. 

Lengua is a treat!
author: Charles W.

description: Have been recently coming here and betraying my other favorite Taqueria. I feel so guilty, but not that guilty because el Buen Sabor is also BOMB! Their style is a bit different. You can get rice and beans with your tacos. The things are massive and they're tasty. I mean, how can you get wrong with a combination of the Mexican classic ingredients. It's why everyone keeps coming back for more!!! Very tasty, fairly priced. Lots of ingredients to choose from. I love it!
author: Priti K.

description: This place literally changed my views on Mexican food and made me realise how much of a failure the Mexican food scene is in London (recommendations welcome!). I went for a simple chicken burrito, packed with rice, beans, salsa etc... and the flavours were INSANE. Absolutely delicious. One of the best meals I had in San Francisco. I didn't get an opportunity to visit any of taqueria's but I cannot fault this place and can't wait to return.
author: Lauren A.

description:
It's set up almost like chipotle style, but more authentic. The reason for the 3 stars is because one of the ladies behind the counter making food was SO rude. I ordered two burritos, and then she tried handing me one and when I told her I ordered 2, she rolled her eyes and shook her head at me! Uhm excuse me, I'm paying for 2 burritos, I'm not sure why my order should be treated like a nuisance. Overall did not feel welcome. 
Luckily the burrito is actually good. I got the veggie California, and added guac but couldn't find any in the burrito. The flavors are yummy and the burrito is a decent size! 
Not sure if I'd ever come here again based solely on the service.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
A great taqueria - big burritos, reasonable prices, and delicious :) They have different burritos you can order based on what 'toppings' you want in the burrito, and you can choose which meat you want separately. I really like their lengua, and the super burrito is a solid quite large burrito (with rice, beans, and guac).

It's really hot inside so I'd suggest getting your food to go and eating elsewhere (like Dolores park nearby), but they do have a few tables inside if you'd like to eat there instead.
author: Theresa L.

description: This place is excellent, everything my partner and I have ordered from here is top notch and we will surely be back next time we're on our way to Alamo drafthouse
author: Natalie P.

description:
This place is all I want in a taqueria. Cheap prices, quality food, quick service-- it's all there.

I usually get a rice & beans burrito with guac, which costs $5 and some change. One issue I have with a number of taquerias is their guac: usually it's just sliced avocado in my burrito. But here, they actually make real guac, which tastes phenomenal. Their rice is also quite flavorful, which adds another dimension to my burrito. 

The location of this place is great as well since it's located a couple blocks from Dolores Park. Order your food to go and enjoy it outdoors at the park!
author: Nicole A.

description:
This is a consistent burrito place right near Dolores park. The burritos taste great, and I like that they offer refried beans. Their al pastor is yummy, but a little greasy. I personally don't mind, but be warned.

They don't give a whole lot of chips with their burritos, and their guacamole is almost a little runny, but their salsas make up for what the guac lacks. Would love to see bigger burritos/portions, given the price.

Side note: I went there today with my friend, and these two girls randomly decided to pay for the entire line's meals! Exciting!
author: Julien I.

description:
This place is below average for burritos in The Mission. Got the super burrito yesterday with al pastor and it's the first time I've ever had dry al pastor, which I didn't think was possible since it's marinated for so long. But it happened anyway. Overall the burrito was pretty bland but generous on portions.

Another bummer about this place is that they don't have a salsa bar and only offer salsa roja at the tables in a squeeze bottle. 

Service is pretty good, and the place has decent seating. If you're in a hurry and just want fill up, maybe. But there are so many other amazing burrito joints in the neighborhood. Unfortunately getting a seat at El Farolito can sometimes be next to impossible.
author: Corbin C.

description: I love the food here so much. Chile verde burrito is my go to! My husband likes their carne asada. The rice and beans are great!! The service is good too. I don't leave San Francisco without stopping here!
author: Amanda C.

description: This place has top quality mexican food! Extremely savory and authentic, and coming from L.A. in a mexican house hold, this place tastes like home. However, this place is not classy, the cashier handles cash and then handles food, and the mopper did not set up a "wet floor" sign. Even then I will give them 4 stars because the food was very good, and the environment was very casual and homey.
author: Jeannie M.

description: Love this place.  Excellent burritos and nice family atmosphere     The green salsa is the best.
author: Mark M.

description: I love this place!!! Nice location by Dolores park and makes for a nice walk around the city. Great tacos, great burritos, and everything else you could possibly want in a taqueria! Service is super fast, despite the long lines, and food comes out nice and warm.
author: Leah Z.

description:
Here's a little story about how Taqueria el Buen Sabor saved my life for just 3 bucks.

It was a Tuesday late afternoon. I had foolishly skipped lunch. I had 30 minutes before my next meeting. Dinner plans were still two hours away. And I only had $3 in my wallet (and I was too lazy to search for an ATM). 

I perused my Valencia Street surroundings. There were certainly numerous food options. But I was on a budget, and I wasn't just hungry... I was hangry. That's when I stumbled upon Taqueria el Buen Sabor! Cue the trumpets!

It definitely doesn't look like much from the outside. It's essentially a no-frills taqueria in the Mission, after all. But hey - it's the Mission. And this is a neighborhood known for its tacos.

I went to the counter and order a basic chicken taco. And by basic, I mean grilled chicken, refried beans, cheese, and salsa on top of a corn tortilla. No fancy guacamole and sour cream and lettuce for me today. They rang me up at the register for just $2.75. And they even threw in some chips free of charge. The taco and chips & salsa were delicious and more than satisfied by hunger pangs. 

I will forever be grateful to Taqueria el Buen Sabor for rescuing me!
author: Kevin B.

description:
This is one of the few mexican places in the Bay Area that offers ground beef as a meat choice.  I know its a bit Americanized, but my crew loves a good ground beef burrito or taco.  The ground beef has little bits of jalapeno mixed in, so its a tad spicy, but not too much so.

Also, since having gone paleo, this place has become a regular spot for me because of their "off menu" meat plate.  You can order their meats without any tortillas/chips/rice/etc.  Just ask them for a series of sides of meats.  You can try a bunch of them.

They also offer meat by the pint to go.  Its about $9 for a pint of the ground beef togo.
author: John S.

description: This place is the best!!! Super burrito with Carne asada was excellent. Also the have the best chorizo I have ever had.  My friend got a chorizo burrito  and loved it. I highly commend this place. Valencia street is a fun place to walk around. Lots of coffee shops boutiques and art.
author: Katie K.

description: Never disappoints. Hands down the best red and green table salsas! Ordered takeout burritos the other night - Super carnitas for B and Super Veggie for me. My son loved the fresh chips came straight out of the fryer. My happy place.
author: Michelle P.

description:
Good food and friendly service their tacos are great
As we got in just 30 people came in and then there was no room to seat
author: Parastoo C.

description: Fast. Delicious. Everything we were looking for in a taqueria in the mission. Great table sauces as well. The carnitas special taco was outstanding and a huge serving. Husband enjoyed the carne asada. Good prices for the portion.
author: Samantha D.

description:
I love all delicious, authentic taquerias in the Mission.

The only reasons Taqueria el Buen Sabor doesn't get 5 stars from me are 1) they're sort of slow when it comes to service, and 2) I'm comparing their carnitas to superior carnitas elsewhere in the Mission.

That being said, I would still be SUPER excited if someone suggested a lunch or dinner here, and I would still verily happily inhale a platter of fish or carnitas (ideally both) tacos in a heartbeat.
author: Kelly R.

description:
We came in around 2pm on Sunday. I loved the smell of the place and it looked like people were enjoying themselves.

The menu is similar to the other taquerias you've been to; a little bit of this and a little bit of that.

I had some time to start taking some pictures, while my wife put in the order and paid for the food.

When she came back I was expecting her to have the food already or tell me the order would be ready soon.  My wife told me she waited by the counter for almost 10 minutes. There was eye contact, but no verbal acknowledgement or gesture to indicate that they would help her.

She was frustrated and so was I, so we immediately left for a better service experience down the road.

This place has good ratings, so I guess the food must be good. Even though we didn't get a chance to try it, the service left a bad taste, so I won't be coming back for a second chance.
author: Brian F.

description: Came here on a busy Friday afternoon after hanging out at Dolores Park with some friends. After trying many other taquerias in SF, this taqueria wins a spot for their simplicity and delicious food!! Thinking of stopping by tonight and getting some regualr carne asada tacos tonight !!!
author: Liset O.

description: This places knows how to make a stomach happy. I had 3 tacos. 1 of al pastor, 1 of asada and 1 of carnitas. They were all delicious. A little on the pricey side but each taco was packed with meat. About double filling that you might find at any other taco spot in L.A. the red and green salsas they had out on the tables were both delicious it was hard to choose which to use. So I switched up with every bite took. When I go back to San Francisco I'll most def hit this spot again. I'll admit I was a bit skeptical when I seen store bought hard shell taco shells on top of the counter. But they didn't use those for the tacos I ordered. P.s. they put a small amount of beans in each taco. Your choice between black or pinto. Very nice touch!
author: George R.

description:
The food is GREEAAAAT!!! But...maybe don't go here if you're black...?
I've been treated poorly three times here over more than a year. 
The first time, people kept getting served before me and so the guy behind me asked them to serve me before him. (He was black and probably not liking what he saw...?)
The second time they served so many people before me that I had to speak up for myself as I watched my burrito just sit on the counter (like 15mins just staring at it because I'm patient AF)
The third time that prompted this review...I got yelled at because my online order didn't go through with the type of beans...like I control computer glitches...?
I'm going to miss those shrimp burritos but definitely not going to miss being treated that way...?
author: Kagure K.

description: Amazing amazing burritos. Absolutely delicious. This is my default place for lunch/dinner with a veggie super-burrito.  I docked a star because they're not consistent - if they run out of an ingredient (like guacamole) they don't tell you and you're disappointed when you get home and discover there's a missing ingredient. If they have a super busy day I feel like they do make their burritos smaller and it still tastes good, just not as great as it usually is.
author: Elena N.

description: This is a great mom and pop type of place. Authentic Mexican. Reasonably priced, clean and very polite staff. Had a great carnitas burrito. Awesome find in mission district.
author: Bruno C.

description:
Corner taqueria with a big line, but the food was just kinda meh.

I had the machaca burrito, which should have been a flavor bomb with beef, onions, bell peppers, and egg, but it was surprisingly bland. Salsas were solid with a good spice kick though. Portions are tinier than other taquerias in the neighborhood.

The aguas frescas were tasty, and I'd recommend the tamarindo.
author: Kevin L.

description: Stopped in here randomly tonight because on a Sunday, everything had already closed. Ordered the vegetarian quesadilla with a friend and was blown away! The quesadilla was delicious, the green sauce on the tables was spicy and flavorful, and the chips that came with it were a nice surprise! This place was also kind to my wallet. Everyone was very friendly, would definitely come again!
author: Kiana A.

description:
I love them. Great food better service!
 El Buen Sabor, Lechita loves you!!!
author: Grace Anne A.

description: Super delicious! My brother had a super steak burrito and I had a carne asada plate.. Everything was very tasty and the black beans was super delicious to. It's a clean and well cared for spot to. Definitely going back. I
author: Steven N.

description: On the plus side you get a heaping ton of food and they stick it in the microwave, which is stationed front and center on the counter, not hidden in the back like in some more secretive places. Here they don't hide the fact your food is getting the Hungry Man tm treatment. Also I was lucky enough to one of the Chile Rellenos that was pre prepared and reheated. I shoveled the food into my mouth and it filled me up well enough.
author: Jonah V.

description:
Hungry for good food, but short on time?  Then Taqueria el Buen Sabor is the place for you!

I had a Vegetarian California burrito with tofu and a variety of veggies and it was delicious.  Everything is fresh, they even sauteed the vegetables specifically for my order.  But, it's still quick, so don't be turned off by the line.  There are a ton of people behind the counter preparing the orders and my burrito was ready by the time I got up to the cash register.
author: Whitney C.

description: By far my favorite burrito of all time. There is a lot of good Mexican food in the mission but nothing beats their burritos. The refried beans are amazing. I recently got a crunch taco and their nachos which are also very good. You cannot beat this place. It's nice because there typically isn't too bad of a wait either.
author: Jenna G.

description:
My husband has been a regular here for years. Taqueria el Buen Sabor is located in the corner of Valencia st. The place is small but it has place to sit, the staff is nice and attentive, they have a wide menu but their burritos (carnitas) are the best. I have tried the tamale platter, however it wasn't my favorite as the tamale didn't have enough flavor. Their green salsa is amazing. 

The place is around a lot of bars so its a great place to stop after some drinks and take some food home. Prices are good and the freshness in the food is there.
author: Suzy R.

description: Went to this place after a not so good happy hour place and was so so happy with the food. There are a bunch of taquerias around this area but definitely worth checking this one out if you're craving good Mexican food.
author: Mallika G.

description: Amazing food. Loved the enchiladas! My fiancé got the beef tongue taco said it was delicious.
author: A J.

description:
Conveniently located near the Women's Building.  Plenty of people there, but it didn't feel too packed.  Great mermaid mural on the wall.  Seems clean.  Chill ambiance.  Not aimed at hipsters but great for hipsters. 

Had a super burrito and chips--they were fantastic. 

Looks like they have churros.  Those might be fun to try.
author: Joseph B.

description:
I was in the mission and wanted to grab a burrito nearby where I was on Valencia. This place looked authentic, so I stopped in for a bean and cheese burrito, which I was in the mood for. At noon there was a pretty good sized line, but not too long, which moved pretty quickly. I added on guacamole. There are a lot of good looking options, including different meats in different salsa marinades but I wanted to stick with what I came for and got it to go. 

The lady who took my order was nice and the cashier was also. She initially rang up my order to be $5.98 but without me saying anything, she looked at the description on my burrito tin foil and talked with the lady who made my order and changed it to $5.19, so I was happy to give $6 and asked her to keep the change. (Btw, credit cards are for orders $10 or more, otherwise use cash). They also scoop warm tortilla chips into your takeout bag. When I got home half an hour later, it was still warm and delicious. The black beans, mozzarella, and guacamole combination had a great flavor and was good with some Tapatio hot sauce (I forgot to grab some salsas at the restaurant).
author: Sara M.

description: After hearing the sounds of Latin music blaring from this place, we were drawn in. It was busy which is always a good sign, but the tables turn over quickly. You go in and order, grab your food and have a seat. Clean up after yourself and grab your own water. Casual, efficient, inexpensive, and most importantly, tasty.
author: Monica V.

description: This is the first place that I have found that serves amazing, authentic, cheap Mexican food in the city. 10/10 would recommend to a friend
author: Josh D.

description: best veggie burito in the city!!!!!!!!!!! They actually grill fresh veggies and have some of the freshest ingredients!!
author: Rachel H.

description: This shit is fire asf I got a burrito and my boy got the enchilada plate. Lookin like a snack so I had to succ it down. No homo.
author: Dalton S.

description:
The first step to getting over an addiction is to admit you're addicted. 
So, I'm here to confess that I'm an addict for their salsa. Both red and green.
I buy pints of it, and smother it on just about anything.
Eggs, steak, their burritos, sure....or anything else I can get my hands on.

I would probably eat my own Nike's if they covered it in their salsa.

That said, I come here at least 3x a month. For their "special" burrito, and their Chile Relleno.

Love it. 

I know everyone has their favorite burrito spot, but unless they have the salsa to go with it....I'm not going anywhere.
author: Jack R.

description:
This place is everything I've ever wanted in a taqueria. And it's obviously loved, as you can see from the constant line. 

The burritos are made to order and reasonably priced. Especially for what you get. The staff move quickly so you're never waiting long. And everything is made in house. The home made guacamole (which you can also buy to go) is out of this world. 

There is seating inside but it's usually taken up. So I'd recommend coming here, grabbing your burrito and heading to Delores park only three blocks away. 

There is also beers in the fridge and home made tortilla chips. This is my go-to place when I'm near Delores!
author: Laura D.

description:
Fantastic fish tacos. Fresh fish, made to order, fairly large portions... this taco has got me coming back and back again to this restaurant. The fish taco is under $4 after tax and takes a little longer to prepare than the other tacos, but are well worth the wait. I'm not particularly fond of the other meat tacos, maybe besides the carnitas, so I personally would stick with the fish. 

The restaurant isn't large but has ample seating. The staff are friendly and there's a washroom in the back.
author: Bernard H.

description: Big portions, good prices and tasty. My favorite is the carnitas super burrito with a fanta. The taco plates are big and tasty too. They do crispy tacos which my friends like to eat. I ask for extra avocado. You will be full after you eat here, for a good price.
author: Sam M.

description:
Sometimes I feel like people are looking at me funny, asking themselves "what are you doing here?" But it fits in to my guidelines well. Look around, your the only white guy in the place, it must be good!

The place is small, the the kitchen is a power house.
The super nachos are so huge. The place is family friendly but the dinning area is not seriously comfortable, its geared mostly towards the working individual who needs a quick bite. No white linen table cloth, just simple tables. hey have a nice selection of bottled beer and great food.

A little red salsa, a little green salsa and its amazing.
I will be back  over and over doing the same thing. Super Nachos!

I used to jump in here and grab my food and take it to the bar down the street at happy hour, they were cool with it, win win!
author: Ben M.

description:
If you're drunk and the food from here was the only thing that you remember last night, then they've done it right. 

Now, I think I've had a chicken taco, but the atmosphere and pricing was perfect to attempt a quicker path to sobriety.
author: Ryan K.

description: This place served up the fattest burrito of my life. The California veggie was filled with broccoli, onion, carrots, etc that they started sautéing on the spot when I ordered, rice, beans, and tofu. It was as big as my forearm, and since it was made to order, so hot I needed all 10 layers of napkin that were put in my to go bag to hold the baby without burning my fingers. I literally inhaled this burrito. The veggies were amazing and exploding with flavor. The rice was tender and flavorful, and the beans were cooked perfectly. Next time I'd leave out the tofu because it didn't add anything tastewise, just contributed all the more to my burrito induced food coma. Usually I smother my Mexican food in salsa, but this burrito was so delicious on its own, salsa detracted from the flavors within. Chips also came hot and crispy. All in all, this place is a winner.
author: Cathy J.

description: Alright, that is definitely not happening again. I've had some bad burritos, but that one takes the cake. A super burrito will run your $10, so it's not exactly cheap, but now I understand why this place is so empty all the time. 10pm, prime taqueria time, place is empty. I decide that this might be a good idea. Super burrito, al pastor, to go. Tortilla is not grilled or pressed. Al pastor is scooped without being reheated or refried. All ingredients are slapped onto this cold tortilla, including lettuce and cold sour cream. Burrito comes out cold and mushy and salty. Sorry, not coming back, not recommending to anyone. Why did I do that to myself? What is with the star rating for this place? Are people on Valencia just oblivious because of their hipster glasses?
author: Danny C.

description:
Best taco in town!!! They're full and two will do. The service is fast, though the place is tiny, so whether you eat in or take out, you'll love it. 

Fresh ingredients, tasty rice and beans, they also have horchata and beer. The menu is pretty versatile.

So if you're hungry in the Mission and want easy yummy food, come here!

The prices are fair, so it's good value for the money.
author: Jose S.

description:
Super Lengua burrito - no beans extra rice. togo bag = $9.24

comes with avocado, sour cream, cheese, rice, beans
author: Sam C.

description: Solid veggie burrito - there are also several versions; I opted for the CA veg, since it came with more/a variety of veggies. Definitely plentiful, and very filling. No rice/tofu was perfect for me. Will try a super veg next time with light dairy. :p
author: Shendi X.

description: Amaze balls!!! Really delicious tacos, great price. Got 6 chicken tacos, a side of rice and 2 drinks for 23. You can't beat that
author: Robert M.

description: I remember coming here when I was pretty new to the city, and entered again recently. They have pretty good tacos, good price; just an overall great taqueria. The juice I got was no bueno though; I remember it being super sugary and I had to water it down. I'd recommend checking it out if you're in the mission!
author: Juliana P.

description:
This. This, my fellow Yelpers is my go-to burrito spot. It's where I take my friends who are visiting, it is where I can rely on for its consistency, and it is what I crave more often than I care to admit to.

Even though I've come here for years, I can't speak on the various menu items. I generally stick with the classic, Grilled Chicken Super Burrito. I've had the nachos, which will give you a workout by just lifting the heavy thing.

I've been with friends who have had menu items that they weren't pleased with, such as the carne asada, or a taco. But me? I'm on cloud nine made of black beans and dreams, friends.

Loads better than the late night spot by the BART station, or the place that won best burrito in the country. (My SF people know EXACTLY where I'm talking about)

Note: I wrote a draft for this review about a year ago, and forgot to post it. I went back earlier this week for an El Buen craving and it satisfied my pants off!

I usually will dictate what bars to go to based off of my proximity to this gem. My girlfriend (jokingly) gets jealous when I call this place my burrito mistress and make up burrito love songs to serenade every time I walk by. There is a reason... This place is great! Stop reading this and stuff yo faaace!
author: Darius Y.

description: Mmmmm I quite enjoyed the al pastor nachos from here. It was a massive plate of chips, tomatoes, avocados, and savory al pastor pieces blended in with cheesy goodness. Oh my this is probably the perfect drunchie you will find if you are bar hopping around the mission area. There was a constant line of hungry customers even while we were eating and everyone seemed to really enjoy their food. I thought this was comparable to the Mexican food I've had in San Diego although I didn't try their tacos or burritos.
author: Anna Z.

description: Great food. Had to try the super nachos bc every 3rd picture is if them. Lol they were amazing! I also have the flautas (taquitos) which were the bomb!
author: Silver F.

description: AMAZING TACOS. And they have tofu. So so good. I will be bringing my friends back here. Tip: order your food to go and eat it overlooking the at Dolores Mission park.
author: Laura S.

description: Just visting SF and I found a local Taco place. Tastes like home. Very delicious food and kind women working there. Next time I come back to SF I will be coming back for sure. Great job Guys!!!
author: David M.

description: Wandered into Taqueria el Buen Sabor after visiting Mission Dolores Park with the family.  Everyone enjoyed their food -- the special burrito w/sour cream for my daughter, a super burrito for my husband and a very plain beef, bean and rice burrito on whole wheat tortilla for my son who has food allergies.  I ordered the super nachos with chicken and the everyone shared them with me...we could not finish the platter -- it was a lot of food.  We will definitely be visiting again!
author: Patti B.

description:
For $20 at this local neighborhood taqueria we got 6 tacos (the carnitas were the best), a beer, a DC, and chips with salsa. Hands down the cheapest meal while we were in SF.

The tacos were authentic with fresh cilantro and onion on top and then christened with the salsa verde which gave it just the right amount of kick.

Don't let this no frills establishment scare you...it's not fancy but it cranks out some damn good Mexican.
author: Kelleigh M.

description:
After an afternoon of hanging out at Doc's Clock, we needed some sustenance.  We  mulled the options---Chinese, Thai, Peruvian, Italian, etc.---and it quickly became apparent that nothing short of a Mission-style burrito would do.

There are a million and one burrito places in the neighborhood and you probably won't go wrong with a lot of them.  Taqueria el Buen Sabor, though, is certainly a worthy choice.  

I ordered the Super V, a long, slender, vegetarian burrito stuffed with beans, rice, cheese, and all the accouterments.  Densely packed with both ingredients and flavor and tightly wrapped, the logistics of this meal were impressive.  Unfortunately, the burrito was also tasty enough that I found myself craving another after I got back to my hotel.

While they don't sell California burritos stuffed with french fries, they do make some damn fine food.
author: Richie K.

description:
This corner taqueria was one of my lunch spots when I went to Mission High School, which is located up the block and not far from Tartine Bakery, Mission Dolores Park and Bi Rite Creamery some two decades ago. If case you are asking; the top gelato spot and the popular bakery were not around when I was in high school. 

One of my first tastes of my first burritos also came from this taqueria as well. Although the price has slowly increased through the years, the burritos, tacos, sandwiches, and fresh iced-cold Latin beverages still taste the same from the first time I have them. 

Thanks for my useful education in obtaining a job in the city and exploring more of the city and the Mission District, I've have only been here like fifty times ever since graduating high school. My latest visit was a few weeks ago when I was craving for a plate of Super Nachos. The dish was $6.00 twenty years ago, now $8.00, the dish had a choice of meat (I got grilled steak), sour cream, refried beans, guacamole, salsa, onions and melted cheese on top of crunchy tortilla chips. Nacho plate was huge back then, but look smaller now, still the dish still has the same yummy taste and recipe. 

I just want to revisit my old stomping ground and see any changes occur. Unfortunately, yes!
author: Matt G.

description:
Okay spot for a burrito but their nachos are good. La taqueria is definitely way better but closes much earlier than this place.

The place does feel a little nicer than Taqueria Cancun but once again I have to side with Cancuns food as better.

I think the meat quality is on par but what did it for me was how inconsistent the ingredients we're spread in the carnitas burrito. I found lettuce only at the top and bottom (and the lettuce was distracting from the rest of the burrito).

Still, it was a solid spot without too much of a line or fighting for a table. Just not something I would go out of my way for.
author: Victor W.

description: Super quick bite and really delicious and juicy beef. Even the chips are delicious! I ordered a burrito especial and really enjoyed how fresh everything was!
author: Camilo O.

description: Probably the best tacos i've ever had. the people who work there feel like family and it's such a homey and cool place. love it
author: Matilda V.

description:
Honestly, I would have never come to this spot if I was not hanging out in the Mission on a random Wednesday, and it was open and across the street from the corner I was when I realized I was hungry.

I'm glad I got hungry.  Wasn't expecting much but was pleasantly surprised.  Got three tacos (2 Carne Asada, 1 Al Pastor).  The meats were juicy and flavorful and were portioned well onto the tortillas.  Service was quick and friendly.

That's all you can really ask for right?  Not quite Cancun or El Farolito's top tier status, but hey, short lines and good food makes it good in my book!  

Plus they were there when I was hungry!
author: Veasna H.

description: Love the tacos! I chose el pastor and it was delicious I had a corona. Very friendly staff.
author: Gladys N.

description: It's a little hole in the wall and boy it's it my favorite. Every time somebody from out of town comes around I tell them we are going to a hole in the wall Mexican place. They always give me that face  but when we sit to eat they give me . So if you want some REAL Mexican food for the cheap trust me when I say please stop here.
author: Monee C.

description:
I'm honestly disappointed. None of the reviews I saw here used the opportunity to cheesily play "Buen Sabor" in to one of their reviews. Well I'll do it.

Taqueria el Buen Sabor offers exactly what is promised. Burritos, Tacos, and Quesadillas with "buen sabor" [great flavor]. Like every other joint in the Mission, it offers a wide variety of customizable options to get your grub on. However, there are only 3 kinds of meat - Beef/Steak, Chicken, and Pork al pastor (No carnitas here, guey!)

I'm a huge fan of their salsa verde (which in this case, refers to an avocado-based sauce, rather than a tomatillo-based sauce. That's cool - I'm always partial to salsa de aguacate, and they were more than happy to put some in my burrito and grab some for my free chips.

I've gotten a burrito al pastor, and a Suiza from here. Both were good, but you need to exercise some common sense in eating them. Don't be dumb, reheat that Suiza when you get home or else it's going to taste like congealed cheese and regret. Be responsible.

The burrito is great - Just what I needed as a late night snack and still great for lunch afterwards. Standard generously-portioned Mission size.

All in all I'm going to make this my usual spot. Why eat ordinary when you can eat extraordinary?
author: Roger F.

description:
Stumbled on this place after wandering around the Mission for awhile, and we saw some San Francisco cops leaving as we were crossing the street to check it out. We figured any place the policemen eat would be good, and I'm definitely following that rule again in the future.

I had the grilled fish burrito and it was to die for. The homemade red & green salsas on the table are delicious. I meant to only eat half and save the rest for later, but...nope. No frills, especially the bathroom (pretty disgusting) and tables (dirty), but the food was amazing and that's probably all that matters in the end. I will probably dream about that burrito.
author: Courtney R.

description: While I don't hesitate to give Buen Sabor four stars, I find it hard to do much differentiating between the taco places I've tried in the Mission. I've been to four so far (maybe five) and have had delicious meals at all of them. This one is close to where I work, so it's especially convenient. The staff was friendly and the food came out quickly, hot, and tasted great. I ordered two tacos: one carnitas, and one carne asada. Both were loaded up on the tortillas with plenty of meat and toppings. I will happily stop by again.
author: David B.

description: Solid no-frills Mexican food. I got two chicken enchiladas a la carte plus a side of rice, and it came out to $5.71 including tax. You order at the counter, they make your food fresh, then bring it to the cashier when it's done and you're paying. The line moves decently fast. Tacos are a bit on the pricier side, starting at $2+ for the basic beans + meat taco, but they're a decent size, and they don't skimp on the meat. I didn't really like their chips, and they don't have a salsa bar, hence the 3 stars. The food was good and filling though. No ambience to speak of, self-bus tables and stools that are basically rectangular wood rates.
author: Leslie H.

description:
I'm from LA and am
A Mexican food snob, as it is my favorite. And this place is the real deal! Food is delicious, options are amazing, ingredients are super fresh, and the staff is wonderfully friendly and accommodating. Couldn't recommend it more for awesome, quality, affordable, authentic Mexican food.
author: Miss M.

description:
Got minor food poisoning from here. 
Scoreboard:
Mission Mexican food 2 - 0 Me.
author: Kazu O.

description: I've had better quality tacos at mediocre taco trucks for the same price and a shorter wait. The carne asada was very tough.  Also, while I took my daughter to the bathroom someone walked in off the street and stole my tacos. So... that was a bummer too.
author: Erich V.

description: There are several awesome taquerias in the area, but this is my go-to. They're delicious, reasonably priced, fast, and not totally overrun with hipsters or tourists... not that I can honestly object to either except that they're putting extra space between my burrito and my mouth. I really like their carnitas (not too greasy) and so I'm clearly not a vegetarian, but I also enjoy their veg options when I'm not in the mood for meat. If this place ever leaves me the mission is officially over.
author: Sebastian T.

description: As a mission neighborhood native i guess  you can say i am a burrito connaisseur. I have had my fair share of burritos and i must say El buen sabor lives up to its name. Just thinking about that juciy burrito makes my taste buds go wild. Fresh ingredients, juicy steak and subtle spice makes for a good time. However, compared to their neighborhood competitors they are a bit overpriced. All in all i do recommend.
author: Leli C.

description: Just ordered a shrimp burrito, got home and it was essentially a bean/cheese burrito with tons of sour cream. Did they think that just because it was late on a Friday night that I was drunk and that I wouldn't notice? Naturally it was "to go" so I didn't notice until I got it home. Not happy.
author: Suzanne A.

description: I crave this place. It's inexpensive and a perfect hole in the wall down in the mission. I'll happily drive a few miles to get the tacos al pastor.
author: Alexander M.

description:
I sort of expected the difficulty in communicating, and maybe both of us could have tried a bit harder. 

What I didn't expect was such a bland taco right there in the Mission.
author: Meg W.

description:
I will have to agree with another reviewer that they SKIMPED on the sour cream and guacamole but I guess it makes it "healthier". But I don't go to taquerias and order a super burrito when I'm trying to watch my calorie intake either so come on. Altogether a semi-bland burrito. 

Chips looked rather sad sitting in an opened tray near the front counter so I passed when they asked if I wanted any. 

Definitely not my first choice for a burrito but if I was extremely hungry and was nearby I suppose I wouldn't mind it.
author: Esther A.

description:
Good solid Mexican food. It's exactly what you expect, so it's a solid 3 stars. Is it (relatively) cheap? For SF, definitely. Is it fast and hearty? Yup.

You get a giant heaping dinner plate of rice, beans, and meat for $10 or so. I got camarones a la diabla, which was good but wasn't spicy - more mild and sweet. I also was hoping that they would have vegetables to add (like a salad/salsa/pico de gallo bar). Overall, decent and really hits the spot when you want cheap Mexican food.
author: Sylvia L.

description: I order their super veggie burrito on the regular.  I order through Yelp and get to bypass the line.  I dig the restaurants casual vibe, the cost, and the ease of ordering online.
author: j. t.

description:
Solid Super Carne Asada Burrito definitely a 4-star spot... Can't rival La Taqueria but definitely worth putting in the rotation.

Not much seating and the super is $8.50.
author: Dan C.

description:
Average burritos. 
No salsa bar. 
Cramped space. 

16th has better taco places. 

If you see a taqueria full of white people and no Mexicans, than you know the food has been turned down a little.
author: Harry V.

description:
Good food. Really good. Favorite restaurant. Happy. Very nice place !!! 
Must make longer review...
I like the burrito
Also the quesadilla 
All the food is good
El buen sabor is my favorite taqueria
author: Evan B.

description: The al pastor, carnitas and carne asada tacos are to die for! Super hidden gem! I loooove the nachos too!
author: Angela A.

description: Best burrito ever. Ask for a carne assada super burrito and you won't be disappointed!
author: Marilia S.

description: Went here for the first time yesterday around 2:30pm to try the grilled chicken burrito with black beans, rice, pico de gallo, and guacamole. I like that it was a good size and they did not overload it with crazy portion sizes. I was able to eat the burrito with one hand, yay! The other hand was to hold the squeeze bottle to slather my burrito in their delicious salsa. The burrito comes with a few tortilla chips, totaling to about $8.50. There is a $10 minimum to use credit cards. The grilled chicken is well-seasoned and juicy, which is hard to find at some other restaurants. Overall, the food is good and worth a visit.
author: Jane P.

description:
Too legit to quit. This place has huge freaking quesadillas.. Suizas? What's the difference? Whatever. I came twice in one week to bring noms to Dolores Park. The lengua (my go-to) is really good, steak and chicken were fine, chorizo was weird don't get that. Comes with chips and salsa, though I guess they're stingy with the salsa/ my friends are salsa fiends.

Takes credit omg.
author: Vivian H.

description: Service was a bit slow, but it was a fun place to visit. I would like to try a few more of those tacos!
author: Jane F.

description:
Wasn't overwhelmed with their food, though I lived in the Mission a long time and ate A LOT of burritos so I have really high standards. The rice was mushy with muddled flavor, and the meat (carne asada and pollo asado) wasn't grilled enough so didn't have a contrasting texture to the rice n beans. Overall effect was bland and texture-less. 

The horchata was from a machine, obviously a mix, and tasted that way (like the difference between frozen oj and fresh-squeezed). The chips were crunchy and fried in fresh oil (a plus) but lacked salt. The salsa picante and salsa verde were tasty, but the salsa fresca had too much onion and didn't taste that fresh.

On the plus side, the staff were really nice and (as is usual in a taqueria), efficient. And the location's convenient.
author: Suzan H.

description: One of the tastiest maxican taquiera in town. The variety is really good. An awesome selection of standard burritos, tacos and more. Make sure to specify your spice level clearly as they make the burritos pretty quickly. Not much room to sit but hey you can do a takeout to Dolores Park and enjoy people watching while devouring your burritos.
author: Zaki S.

description: The super nachos are the best thing ever. And the super tacos are wonderful. Highly recommend this place for a lunch spot!
author: Kayla K.
