description: I came here on a Tuesday because my go-to taqueria, Taqueria Cancun, was closed.  I was quite pleased with my chicken super burrito - it was flavorful and well-balanced.  The service was quick and friendly!
author: Barnali D.

description: Excellent tacos for an excellent price with a solid beer selection. Perfect for groups with large tables or grab to go for Dolores park. Can't go wrong with anything here.
author: Jason R.

description: Best veggie nachos in the mission. Service is great and fast! Right by Dolores park order a model with your nachos togo and you'll be so content.
author: Kendra B.

description: Best Taqueria in San Francisco in my point of view. Their burritos are simply delicious and really cheap. The best thing you can do is to order one and eat it at Dolores park because the restaurant is not really cosi.
author: Sara-Fleur S.

description:
This is my second-favorite taqueria in the Mission, behind El Metate. Both taquerias make a similar style of burrito -- longer and thinner than most, but super tightly packed. For me, it's the perfect form factor. The more common, fatter burritos offered at most taquerias are just more difficult to eat.

I think they're a bit overpriced (Metate is better and cheaper.) but I often stop in when I'm nearby. I definitely like it better than the other taquerias near it. (El Farolito, Taqueria Cancun, etc.)
author: Adam N.

description: This is my favorite taqueria in SF and possibly anywhere. I always get the super chile relleno burrito and it is absolutely delicious. I don't know how this place isn't on more top 10 burrito lists, but I'll take it because the lines aren't usually crazy long. This place isn't as well known as other burrito places in The Mission and there are other good options, but this is the best. I won't go anywhere else.
author: Jonathan A.

description: As authentic as it gets for a Mission District Taqueria. They offer your traditional meats from grilled chicken, al pastor, chile verde, carnitas, etc. The portions are decent and the prices are super reasonable. I have been here no less than a dozen times and will continue to patronize it.
author: Gabriel B.

description:
YES!!! A million times yes!  This place is awesome and I'm so happy it's in this neighborhood.  Plentiful tacos, plentiful sides, plentiful chips.
Just the right amount of spice and these people are nice!
author: Koa K.

description: First time we've tried this place ( on a Saturday morning) after seeing a line out the door on a different night. So good!! Tacos were big and only $2.60. The chile rellenos was good as well. Best taqueria I've been to outside of the D.F.
author: Isabel P.

description: In the midst of all the burrito noise in the Mission, this place serves up the best damn vegetarian burrito in the area. Its called the California Vegetarian and includes bell peppers, zucchini, broccoli, tofu, beans and the usual burrito suspects. Most veggie burritos in the mission only give you beans, guac, and rice.. which is super lame in my opinion. I'm ok with this place being under the radar compared to some of the other mexican places since I really hate long lines. So shh.. don't tell anyone ok?
author: Henry W.

description:
This place has the best burritos in SF hands down, super authentic, flavor profile is near perfect, always fresh ingredients. Great for grabbing to go orders to keep exploring the city or sit nearby in the park and eat. 

There is seating inside, it is a bit dark, but still good to window watch the people going by. 

Will always come back whenever I'm on that side of the city or get a craving.
author: Chase S.

description: I love this place! There burritos are great and the perfect meal to have while hanging out at or after the park. I usually get an al pastor super burrito and it never fails to satisfy. Prices are great and they are really quick so you'll be in and out.
author: Greg H.

description:
Solid taqueria with a good variety of options on the menu. Burrito al pastor - my go-to - was delicious and extremely filling.

Location is on a busy corner, so there is a constant stream of customers and prices are slightly more than you'd expect. But hey, this is SF.
author: Jason T.

description: Great Mexican in the Mission - where Mexican is severely overrated.  Most places in the area aside from Pancho Villa are barely edible, so this place really stands out.  Nice friendly ladies behind the counter whip up burritos however you want.  Vegetarian options?  Don't know and don't care.  The nachos are a favorite, covered in their surprisingly spicy house salsa.  Cold beer available. Very inexpensive.  Limited seating, and it's a stopping point for derelicts - better off getting take out.  Parking sucks everywhere in the Mission, but you can roll the dice like I do and park right in front of the place in front of the hydrant in the red zone while you rush in and grab a to-go order.  No tickets so far....
author: Ken P.

description:
No worries if you couldn't remember the rest of this review. Just remind yourself that green salsa tastes well with meat while the red salsa bottle goes best with chips. Yup, salsa is kinda like wine if you want it to be, especially with tomatoes carrying a high level of antioxidants. It's like dat!

I've passed by this place countless times. It's always on my way to other restaurants so I decided it was time to stop by. It was dinner time and their communal tables were empty but looked welcoming nonetheless. The colorful exterior is sensitizing while the location is attractive as the door points straight at the tip of the bustling corner of Valencia Street and 18th. The non-matching checkered floors, red brick décor, and xmas lights were not enough to distract me from turning to their hanging menu and steaming food counter where numerous meats, beans, fried goods, and tortillas options were on display. Excited by what I saw, I turned to the cashier and asked, "What is good here?" With lots of charisma, she smiled and responded, "everything", and smiled again.

The server's response was warm and assuring but not helpful for Yelpers like me who was trying to draw their finest. Eventually my order of carnitas dinner plate ($8.20) came with pork, Spanish rice, black beans with melted cheese smothered on top, guacamole, sour cream, and thick salsa. On the side were fresh chips, and four delicious hand-warming corn tortillas served in a foil. The dish was non-soggy on the dry side with pork and Spanish rice nicely seasoned and the score of black beans were on point. I thought braised pork was rough in a few spots and guacamole could be thicker. The bottles of red and green salsa at every table were helpful kicks as I took turns in trying each on everything that was on the plate. I'm more a flour tortilla person but the corn option was a nice change of scenery for my palate. The horchata was cinnamony but also diluted with a dull finish.

Service was friendly and my food was brought to the table even though the arrangement has self service written all over. I thought this place is a solid Mexican taqueria amongst many that are here in the Mission District. Solid 3 stars for the overall experience. I hope to come back to give them another try.
author: Daniel L.

description: Love this place. This is my favorite burrito in the mission. Also have massive tacos and nachos. I order it SPECIAL with guac and cheese but SUPER also includes sour cream. Everything comes loaded. I get tofu or green chicken but my the carnitas are great too. Tip: if you like jalapenos, request extra and they'll add them from the salsa bar. Only thing is they skimp on chips - sometimes get like 5. But it really doesn't matter b/c the rest is so big I can barely finish anyway.
author: Kristin T.

description: This place is underrated and awesome. The tacos are huge. The burritos are huge. I especially love the giant breakfast burritos, which are also awesome. It's reasonably priced and there's not usually a huge line.
author: Alex K.

description:
Solid Taqueria on Valencia, with an amazing selection and great prices. I am a huge fan of their "special" burritos and they offer it with all the meat choices including my three favorites: Al Pastor, Carnitas and Chorizo. I also like the fact that you can see the big hunks of diced peppers in their "spicy salsa", it truly is fresh. 

It's a tiny joint with not much in the way of ambiance or visuals inside the taqueria but the food is great and it's open late so this is a perfect place to stop for a quick bite in the Mission.
author: G C.

description: Delicious authentic mexican food. Their jalaoenios are really hot, and their hot sauce is really hot. no fu-fu watered down salsa here. Loved it. Filled me up great. Quick service.
author: Zita M.

description: Tasty and cheap. We had cold beer, special burrito, fish taco's and corn chips with guacamole. It was great cheap food with an upbeat vibe. Everyone felt welcome, the music and decor were on point!
author: Audrey W.

description:
This is quite possibly the best taqueria in Mission!

The true measure of a taqueria is how good their lengua and chorizo tacos are and their's are absolutely satisfying! The carnitas tacos are delicious as well. 

I ordered my tacos "special" but I chose to hold the rice upon revisit. Their red and green salsas are absolutely homemade and incredibly tasty. Three tacos and I was stuffed!

Their guacamole is good and you get a good helping, although I do wish the price was a little better. Seating is limited but the line in and out moves well. 

A bit of an Easter egg is the Madonna statue with the angel that looks like an Elvis cherub. Let me know if you see it!

Before going to the trendy place up the road to wait an hour, go here! You will be glad you did.
author: Anthony S.

description:
We tried the lengua taco and a horchata.  

The lengua was ok - they heat it up when you order it.  The tortillas were stuck together and disintegrated when it is picked up, sad.  At other places, I can normally separate the tortilla.

Taco is served with some free chips.  There are two sauces at tables you can use.
author: Gloria H.

description:
I have a pretty serious breakfast burrito addiction, and I think this experience helped me learn that super delicious authentic taquerias may not actually be the best places to get breakfast burritos, as they aren't really an authentic taqueria dish. Nevertheless, it was close and my breafkast burrito withdrawls were starting to kick in so I gave it a shot. 

I think that on any other occasion and for any other meal, this place would earn a four or five star rating from me. But for my particular hungover b.b. needs. I have to say I was a bit disappointed. Though it was absolutely huge, I didn't love the way the chorizo and scrambled eggs were mixed together.. made the texture weird somehow. The chips also weren't the freshest, though I did absolutely love the salsa that it came with. It'd be a good value if shared with someone else as it was enormous and I could only eat less than half. 

So take this review with a grain of salt - I fully intend to return and have a torta or regular burrito in the future and I will definitely update then!
author: Christina P.

description:
Best carnitas in the Mission, no contest.

Tacos are very good and they are generous with the fillings. I don't care too much for their burritos because the tacos are the real stars here.

Their homemade salsas are super tasty (but not very spicy).

If you are looking for a cheap, filling, quick and fresh meal, this is a good, honest option
author: Eli E.

description:
Every time I'm in San Francisco this is the first stop for me after the long flight from Australia. 
The super burrito is so great.
author: Dan V.

description: Delicious breakfast burrito elevated by the amazing green salsa, all prepared by jovial and courteous staff. Best way to start the day!
author: Marion V.

description:
Tastes three times as good as other taquerias that cost twice as much. 

Is it truly a 5-star joint? No, probably more like 4, but this is an example of the real Mission and the old SF and definitely the kinda place I wanna support.
author: Jay S.

description:
Amazingly delicious Carnitas! My boyfriend and I come from the opposite side of town just to eat here. The workers are very hard workers and friendly. 

I will definitely come back as I always do.
author: Jasmin M.

description: Genuine, original and tasty tacos.  We tried 5 different types of tacos, including some unusual ones like tongue, chorizo and tripe and all were excellent. Fair prices and quick friendly service.
author: n p.

description: Went here with my friends a couple of days ago. It was fairly decent abs had benches as seats which was pretty good. The service wasn't very time efficient or effective really, but it was ok. The menu has a variety of options ranging from burritos to tacos to fries and drinks. The price was not to bad either the cheapest being $3-$10. I ordered the super burrito and I guess I have gotten it so many times that it tastes the same to me. BUT I WILL SAY THAT IT'S FILLING AND GOES GREAT WITH CHIPS. Speaking of chips their nacho platter I recommend, it is quite tasty. Anyway, a great place to hang out and talk with your friends if youre still hungry after Bi-Rite ice cream!
author: Lena T.

description: Reasonable price. Friendly staff. Good food. What more can you ask for heh
author: Bianca C.

description:
It was late at night, my husband and I were around this area and decided to grab something small to eat. 
"Lets go for some tacos!" When we arrived it appeared as if the staff was getting ready to close, cleaning their back kitchen and front counters. We asked if they were closing since the sign outside mentioned they still had more than an hour left till closing time but the lady said they were opened! 

We went ahead and quickly scanned their menu and decided to go for some carne asada and some chorizo tacos. Once ready, we gave her our order and she said they didn't have chorizo (which they did, it was right infront of us) we kindly noted this to her and her response was: "well yes there is some but i'll have to cook it". . .isn't that what restaurant do? We were baffled! So since they were in such a hurry to leave and we didn't want to interrupt we opted for just carne asada tacos. The food was ok, nice sized tortilla and well-stuffed tacos. I don't think we'll return to this place again. Their customer service needs improvement.
author: Betty R.

description: Back in 1993 I was living at 20th and Valencia and trying as many of the tacquerias in the Mission as I could. This place was quite memorable and great for take out. They had some delicious and unusual ingredient choices as well. Great for a late night dinner run. I am pleased to hear they are still there.
author: Stiobhard D.

description: Nah. Stale chips. Bland, cold meat. Watery guac. Messed up the order. Two stars for being cheap, cute, and having nice staff. Also, the salsa verde was pretty good (and the only thing that saved my so-called special burrito). Will continue my search for legit Mexican food like I remember being able to easily find in the Mission 15 years ago.
author: Anonymous r.

description:
Carnitas that makes you wanna slap yo mama!  There really isn't much else to say here.  I am not going to try and be cute, funny, explain why it was so good.

Just turn, slap your mom, and ask, why haven't you been cooking like this for me all these years.
author: Diesel P.

description:
Some just don't get it and that's great. There aren't enough tables here and I don't take to long lines when hungry (or any other time for that matter).

So stay away, please. There is no salsa bar with an endless supply of average salsas. They only have two table salsa available: green and red, and if you take your order to go, good luck prying any extras out of their hands. They are stingy. But that's because they know what a good thing they've got and don't want half full cups heading for the trash day in and day out. But seriously, their salsa may one day lead you to a 12-step program. Best not to even try it.

Also, if you want smiley accommodating service, best go to Chevy's. I've been a regular here for years and still have to specify every time, "no cheese, no cream."  If you are vegetarian, or god forbid vegan, you are going to have to work for it. It wouldn't hurt to brush up on your Spanish too.

This is a family run joint that makes everything, including the chips, right there in a tiny little kitchen. They do it right and they don't need to make any excuses and they are not that amused by what you are wearing. So put down that burrito and try the tacos instead so you can taste what you're eating. Just save me that spot by the window.
author: Cory W.

description: Lines are always out the door for a reason. Whether it be tacos or burritos, the staff is quick and the food will definitely satisfy. I usually have to take some home. One of the few places that still takes credit cards.
author: Dana F.

description:
2 tacos - $5.44  You probably can't finish it.  

So much stuff it pours out the side of the tortilla while I eat, then I scoop all that up with the chips.  

Worst part about writing this to support this place is that the lines will get longer.  I generally show up before or after that, though.  

*Please bus your own dishes.  Leaving your crap on the tables means fewer people will get a place to sit down, the lines back up, and one of the staff has to come out from behind the counter (where the food is prepared so the line gets smaller).
author: Steve M.

description:
Had such high hopes for the burritos here but they were just so-so!

Food:
-Chicken Super Burrito- just an average burrito with not much flavor or sauce. just sat there chewing and chewing and chewing with little enjoyment. and still $7.50!
-Veggie Burrito- just too much rice and not much flavor
-Chips & Salsa- greasy chips and just one salsa option!

Service:
Fast check out, but no is bussing the tables and people just leave their trash everywhere so you have to clean up everyone's mess. 

Ambience:
Hole in the wall. Couple of benches and a tables. Nothing fancy at all.

I'd rather go to another taqueria in the mission for my money's worth!

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description: Just what we needed - something quick and not hipster in this oh-so-hip area. Don't get me wrong....I love me some new-fangled-treat-of-the-week, but me and the two teens were famished and NEEDED FOOD NOW. We got spicy pork burrito and chicken burrito and shrimp tacos and were all very happy with our order. PS here's a hint - order shrimp in Mexican joints that have everything else pre-prepared...they do not pre-prepare shrimp so it's always hot off the grill. Yummy beer, good horchata - what more could you want?
author: Laurie H.

description:
This taqueria hole-in-the-wall is the middle ground between "El Farolito" and "Chipotle" Not as greasy/heavy as El Farolito, hipster options that give it the Chipotle feel, but full, mouth-watering flavor!
 
When I saw "tofu" and "veggie" options it made me think of how many hipsters have crawled into this taqueria attempting to speak Spanish. 

Anyways, there are about 5 tables for groups to sit. There are painted palm/coconut trees and a couple of flies zooming around, making you feel in South America. Since the place is so small, the line may go out the door, but its never longer than a 15 minute wait. 

The very first time I ordered, I said (in Spanish), "I really hope the good flavor is there!" She laughed and told me it was, and she would see me here again soon. 

I've never been disappointed by this place. Everything tastes fresh, the price is perfect for all the food you receive!
author: Sophia G.

description:
A friend who has lived on 18th and Guerrero for 4 years was absolutely spot on when he said the Buen Sabor is in the Breakfast Burrito, even for dinner. To be more specific, I will give you guys his recipe...cause I veered away from his suggestion and did my own (albeit healthier) version, and when I tried his I realized I really should have trusted the expert:

- Eggs
- Cheese
- Refried Beans
- Ground Beef
- Sour Cream (key move)

I got all skinny chick and did no cheese, no sour cream, pinto beans, no meat. WTF? If you are silly enough to eat breakfast burritos for dinner, you go all in. 

Duly noted.
author: Serena Q.

description: One of two places I've found in the city that has amazing for pollo verde. Love this taqueria
author: G S.

description: Good burrito, although average by Mission standards.  Portion and ingredient mix was good.  Beans were solid.  Meat was average.  No salsa bar is unfortunate.
author: Tom F.

description: Quick, friendly and great food. I came here after footing around and being disappointed by either long waits or crappy menus from the "trendy" spots. This place was good and made exactly what I asked for. We all had our various ways of how we wanted our burritos but they were completely accommodating. After paying great prices, I destroyed that burrito with some help from their bottles of red and green salsa on the tables. YUM! Perfect amount of spice!
author: Michael H.

description: I don't really get why there always seemed to be a line here.  My burrito was pretty average.  The quality of the chicken (I got the cut up chicken--to be fair, the chicken in sauce looked like better quality) was mediocre, and there just wasn't anything too exciting about the taste...
author: Sandie B.

description: i came here once before and had a fish taco and it was marvelous. came again and split some nachos with a friend and lemme tell you they do not skimp. this plate of nachos is enormous and delicious!!!!!
author: Sammie K.

description: Ate here last week and this may have been the best Mexican food I have ever eaten in the U.S.  I had the super burrito with chicken and it was AMAZING! They are speedy and the food is priced well. Definitely want to come back here next time I'm in the mission. So good!!
author: Sarah K.

description: Yummy. Authentic. Have looked for good basic Mexican for awhile. This meets my needs. I'll try the burritos next.
author: Paula M.

description:
best burrito i have ever eaten!

buen sabor is og
author: John D.

description:
Amazing food, and sweet atmosphere on a sunny afternoon.
Chicken burrito and chips, but no salsa.. haha. oh well. 
ice and water served for free in cool pitchers :)
author: H K.

description:
Good carnitas burrito especial. 

Quick and friendly service. Black beans lacking in flavor but what do you expect. 
Less rice in burrito than other places, they ask you if you want complimentary chips with your burrito which is nice.
author: Charles S.

description:
Tasty Mexican fare.

There are several vegetarian/vegan options. I tried the Veg California, which was filled with lots of veggies and tofu.

Not the best burrito by any means, but it hit the spot. My friends ordered tacos, and they were HUGE. I wished I had done the same.
author: Brandi W.

description: I was recently in San Francisco and was looking for some traditional  Mexican food. We came across this place while hanging out in the Mission and experienced the most delicious quesadillas we'd had in a long while!! I will absolutely repeat a visit here next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Stephanie R.

description: I'm not a vegetarian, but I absolutely LOVE the veggie burrito they make here - they use real fresh veggies (broccoli, zucchini, mushrooms) that they cook up for you upon your order, making your burrito deliciously fresh and tasty. Way better than veggie burritos elsewhere that are just onions peppers and lettuce. The al pastor here is pretty good here too.
author: Amy Y.

description:
This spot is as. good. as. it. gets!

Easily my favorite spot to grab super tacos at, I can't get enough of Taqueria el Buon Sabor!! 

Let me put it this way, their portions are huge!! One Super taco is a meal in itself, however, I always order two since well, I just eat a lot of food. 

They have two very good salsas to add onto your food: one verde and one rojo.

The staff that prepares your food are always courteous, and they fill up your tacos or burritos to the max. 

Keep in mind, they serve all you typical plates here too; enchiladas and more so you can really choose from a lot if Tacos aren't your thing. 

They have great quesadillas here too, I had those once. They have a few types of beer to choose from, an horchata machine, and a solid working bathroom. 

Not bad I'd say. Try one of there super tacos though, seriously, they're the bomb. 

This place is numero UNO, until the day I might find something better.
author: Maximilian R.

description: I was recommended this place because I heard it was good. It was defiantly a good experience the burritos were better than I expected. Very authentic seems like great place for lunch would defiantly come back if I'm in the neighborhood
author: Raul G.

description:
Thank you for:
.being open late
.making decent food
.cheap and right around the corner
.also, you put carrots in your salsa, that's awesome,
/Chris
author: chuck c.

description:
soooo gooood

The carnitas super taco is basically the best thing ever - enormous, cheap, and topped by a huge spoonful of guac. Also, the bathrooms were fairly clean? Yay, hole in the wall restaurant done right!
author: Caroline W.

description: Can't complain except the rice was a little crunchy in the middle. Good flavors and good size but didn't exactly blow me away with the carnitas super burrito. Perhaps their steak is better. Maybe next time. There are so many burrito places in the mission it's hard to stand out.
author: tomohisa w.

description:
This is as close to the most perfect burrito I've ever had.

As an east coaster, good mexican food is difficult to come by, so I came here on the recommendation of not one, but two of my SF pals.  It's a little divey but don't let that fool you.  The staff is friendly and knows their shit, and most importantly, the food is ridiculously amazing.  The super burrito, which comes with the meat of your choice and all the trimmings, is a magical taste explosion.  The ingredients are fresh, delicious, and balanced.  It's also incredibly filling, which makes this cheap eat a definite bang for your buck.

I also appreciated the fact that burritos come with chips (as opposed to being an add-on), and the salsas are spicy without being overwhelming.  I can't think of anything negative to say and I'm most definitely coming back on my next trip out to SF.
author: Barrett L.

description:
It was nearing 10pm and I still hadn't had dinner. With nothing in the fridge, I grabbed my keys, headed out, and in my cranky state, looked for something (anything!) that was open. I saw lights on and charged into this restaurant.

I ordered a Super Burrito with carne asada and couldn't WAIT to get my mouth around it. (Wait... what?)

With this whole gluten-free diet I'm trying, it was almost physically painful to order a burrito without rice and NOT eat the tortilla. I did it, though, and it was delicious! Though there was barely any guacamole (or sour cream, for that matter), the burrito still hit the spot. A bit pricey for Mission standards, but at 10pm, I really couldn't complain.
author: Adena B.

description:
Walking down Valencia, I nearly missed this little taqueria on the corner. I decided to stumble in during lunch time on a Tuesday, the line was non-existent and I was very hungry.

I decided to opt for a super burrito with carne asada. The burrito was about as big as two bricks and weighed as much as one. Watch out for the minimum credit purchase.
author: Sebastian C.

description: This is one of my favorite taquerias in the mission (saying a lot). I usually get carne Asada super tacos (comes with guacamole). Well priced and delicious would definitely suggest!
author: Jenny S.

description: I Could Tell they don't use pork fat for their beans , at the least the black ones I tried, 4 stars just for that , especially if someone is watching their diet a little, thats the place to go , pollo asado plate , guacamole , black means filling , they will put extra chicken for you if you are not getting rice , awesome family place , highly recommended .
author: NAEL K.

description:
The carnitas tacos are what keep bringing me back to this dive. They are to die for. The meat is crunchy and juicy. If small tacos don't fill you up, go for the super taco.

Puerto Allegre doesn't do carnitas taco and Tacolicious is just meh. This is the place to be if you want the real deal.

2 carnitas tacos with chips $4.80
author: Matt Y.

description: Your employees and the food sucks at # 2 taqueria the most nasty food ever eat and your employees there asshole sorry ass plebe
author: Ceasar G.

description:
Tacos that don't disappoint.

I had a chicken and pork taco, and both were great. 4 stars, not 5, but solid. The key was asking for a side of spicy pico de gallo, which was great to dip my chips in, supplementing the more liquidy salsa, and a good old coca cola by the bottle (the kind with real sugar, not corn syrup).
author: Mike G.

description:
If I was a cheap burrito.  I would want to be a cheap burrito from Taqueria el Buen Sabor.

I would be a perfectly steamed spinach tortilla burrito with ample shredded cheese, rice, beans, salsa, guacamole, and some of the most tasty carnitas ever.  Though the carnitas comes off of a steam table, it is put back on the grill for a minute to make sure it is extra tasty.

I would be sturdily constructed and all of my contents would be evenly distributed through my 9" long and 3" wide frame.

I would also be accompanied by a bottle of smoky red salsa on the tables that might have gotten completely demolished then needed to be refilled for further demolishing.

I would be served with pleasant efficiency.

I would only cost $6.00

I wouldn't care if I made myself fat because I would be a burrito.

Is everyone officially weird-ed out by the idea of Susan being a burrito?  Me too.
author: Susan C.

description: This is the worst excuse for enchiladas I have ever encountered, the guacamole was only good when mixed with something else and the chips are inedible. I won't be coming back here.
author: Johnna C.

description: Good mission style food. The quesadilla was really good and they make some tasty stuff quick.
author: Jason H.

description: Total perfection. Fresh, delicious and crazy reasonable.  They're trying their tortilla chips fresh right in front of your face.  Treat yourself to one of their delicious quesadillas and some freshly-made guacamole.
author: Jason T.

description: Still the best taqueria in the neighborhood!  Prices are good, lines aren't too bad, and black bean burritos yummy!
author: Shari H.

description:
After a Sunday funday at the Castro me and my friends wanted a good burrito spot. We knew there weren't any down I'm the Castro area so we decided to take a stroll to the mission area. The walk felt long but hey I was a drunk mess. 

We ended up running into this place and stumbled inside.  Wasn't sure what to order but ended up with a super wet burrito no sour cream.  It was delicious.  I ate every last bite and was temped to get one to go.  Over was a great place to grub and be drunk with my friends.  I would make the trip back.
author: Frankie H.

description: This place makes excellent burritos and tacos. I've tried just about every taco from here, and the meat and flour shell are delicious.  You really can't go wrong with the food here. I recommend the Super Burrito if you're hungry.
author: Nathan Y.

description:
HANDS DOWN the BEST mexican restaurant I have eaten at in SF that is like a whole in the wall spot. Food is amazing and cooked to perfection, service is always pleasant, prices are decent. Tacos are BOMB!!!! 

Love this spot, I cant get enough of it. And it wont leave you running to the bathroom like other places. lol. LOVE IT!!!!!!
author: Krista R.

description:
Was excited when I yelped this location. I had thought I found another good and cheap place to eat So during lunch, I rushed out the door looking for this place.

Once I found it and walked in, there was already a line. As I lined up I began scanning the menu. This was another overpriced burrito joint. They wanted $7.50 for a super burrito bringing it to $8.00 with tax.

So I walked out the door and went to Cancun's for their $6.00 super burrito which was just on Mission near 19th.
author: M C.

description: This is The only place I know of in the Mission where you can get an American crunchy taco made by Mexicans. Blows Taco Bell out of the water!
author: John L.

description: Best Al Pastor super burrito in town. Only ate there once, but could see their other stuff being decent too.
author: Rob G.

description: I hadn't had a Mexican dinner here in San Francisco and today was the first time! Needless to say, it was a good experience here and a nice small spot!
author: Shaniah M.

description: Since I live like a block away I've been coming here all my life and it does not disappoint!! From the vegetarian friendly California burrito to the shrimp burritos, nothing really disappoints! My personal favorite is the Carnitas Special burrito with extra spicy salsa! The workers there are pretty friendly and often give a little side order of chips with every order. This place will definitely fulfill that taqueria craving.
author: Andy C.

description: This place seemed pretty authentic. I am not big on mexican food, but it was okay. I thought this place was a bit pricy, hence the 3 stars. The food was pretty good. One super taco was enough to fill me up. The portions they give with the meat were very generous. I had to start off with a fork just so I can hold the tortilla.
author: Josephine C.

description: This place is very authentic. Has the best hard shell taco I've ever had!!! I didn't even had one this good in SoCal.... T___T
author: Lei-Lei F.

description:
I happened to be walking around this taqueria and feeling very hungry...so I decided to give it a try. 

I ordered the steak quesadilla and the ground beef quesadilla (As I said, I was really hungry!) =)

It was greasy, but absolutely delicious. It was all white cheese (as I requested) on corn tortilla, and nicely cooked meat...so tasty! 

I will definitely be coming back!
author: Monique T.

description:
So one of the reasons I get haircuts at FSC is because its located near a ton of places to eat. I just happened to be craving mexican food and I always noticed this joint. 

Carintas Super Burrito - ordered it sorta San Diego style (no beans no rice). It was pretty good. There tortilla is on the gummier end, similar to Taqueria San Bruno in San Bruno. Probably the freshest salsa I've had in a burrito, ever. The tomatoes were tender and crisp... almost as crisp as the onions. Lettuce was also insanely refreshing. These were perfect, considering how hot it was in the City over the past weekend. The Carintas reminded me of ropa vieja that my grandma and mom used to cook when I was a kid, but not as crispy. Don't get me wrong, there was a good amount of crisp carnitas in the burrito. The pork was a little leaner than I'd like it to be... I prefer my carnitas to be fattier. I would like the pork to probably be a little saltier since it was leaner than most carnitas I've had. 

I definitely want to try the Chile Relleno burrito next time. That just sounds awesome. 3 stars because I like my mexican food a little bit more fatty.
author: Marc T.

description: Yummm, I love Mexican food and this place has prettty decent portions. The prices are alright, but because the carne asada burrito tastes pretty good, I would still come back for more. They give delicious free chips with your burrito and their horchata is at an alright price too. The horchata is okay, just a little watered down sometimes but it still tastes alright. OH another plus is that I can see their kitchen and it looks pretty darn clean~
author: Mel T.

description: One of the best burritos that I've had in sf. Really great flavor and great menu of options. I had the super burrito 1/2 al pastor 1/2 carnitas. It was great. Not to dry, but not overly juicy. I paired my bomb ass burrito with a modelo,  a great end to a day in the park at Delores. My friend had the mushroom quesadilla and added carne asada and the mushroom flavor and tortilla were awesome!  I will definitely return.
author: Sean P.

description: I go here on my lunch break everyday, veggie burritos are only 6$ and it honestly feels like the last non-gentrified business on Valencia!  The servers are very friendly and I get an actual sense of authenticity when I eat here.
author: Derrick C.

description:
I love El Buen Sabor. I don't know any other way to say it. Since I was introduced to this place like 6 years ago, hands down, it has been my favorite taqueria. In fact, when I first was introduced to it, I think I ate there every couple days for about two months, then I told myself - it's probably not a good idea, and I should learn to limit myself. Haha!

I usually get one super taco (it's a generous portion, they really hook it up) or super burrito, they never disappoint. Everything is delicious and flavorful; staff is always friendly. I've noticed it gotten busier and busier every time I go- but the line goes quickly.

*salsa verde is so good!
author: A S.

description: All I can think about is when I can go back to get another veggie California burrito. Absolutely amazing. Broccoli, mushrooms, onions, peppers, is a taste bud explosion. The chips weren't as salty as I would've liked but I'm still giving it 5 stars because my burrito was that good.
author: Samantha S.

description: Love this place. Used to work a block away & this was my go-to. Legit taste in the food, legit music, legit overall feel in this place. My favorite are the shrimp tacos (made to order). Comes with rice, salsa, fajitas, lettuce, sour cream, & cilantro. They pack on the tacos, so I eat some of the filling with chips before I actually pick it up. Free chips! Shrimp tacos have give or take 5 huge shrimp each. Good thing to know, if you're one of those healthy people who like wheat tortillas, they got you. Might not be advertised but they have other tortilla options. Con: it's really damn hot in here.
author: April M.

description:
Today was my first visit but I'll be back. Hot, fresh burritos, tacos and various other tortas. I had the regular burrito and it was wonderful. The flavor ("sabor" as in the business' name) was unique. The beef- I requested pastor style- had been marinated in a very full-bodied, piquant sauce. I thought I could see little bits of garlic in it which I confirmed with the counterperson. It was so delicious!

Oh, another Yelper found the restroom less than nice but my experience was that it was immaculate. The thing is, it's graffitied all over. That's all.
author: Paula H.

description: Sometimes, a place with simple, yet delicious ingredients deserves a simple review. This place is my favorite taqueria in the Mission (& perhaps, the world.)
author: Bryan B.

description:
This was a very good burrito. I got the Super (adds a layer of cheese and guacamole) Carnitas burrito with refried beans and promptly dispatched half of it. The squeezy bottles of smoky roasted red salsa and light tomatillo green sauce are amazing - I almost stole one to take home. The lady at the cash register was super nice and motherly. I liked her instantly. Ambiance was very casual and people who seemed like regulars filtered in and out. The horchata was empty when we walked in so we assumed they were done for the day but halfway through our meal a whole bucket was dumped in - our only regret.

That is to say, this satisfied our burrito craving but didn't blow our minds, but that's really okay. It had been a long day and we were just happy to be filled. (This is the kind of place where if I lived around the corner I'd be here twice a week and could easily bump my review up to four stars. But for now, I just dabble in hanging out in the city.)

Their selection of veggie burritos was really impressive - spinach, broccoli, tofu, among other items I saw on the board. Next time I'll try that or bring a vegetarian friend and that might make the place stand out. For now, just a good, solid burrito that won't break the bank. And it's just a block away from Bi Rite Creamery!
author: Steph C.

description: Food was good but nothing above and beyond. $15 got us 2 burritos that were so tiny I could have mistaked them for taquitos. Maybe not that small but definetly at most the size of a kids burrito
author: Katy O.

description: In from out of town and holy heck what a burrito. Super chicken burrito is out of this world. Could not recommend more.
author: Steve C.

description: I love these little "hole in the wall" Mexican food places! This one is clean, with deeeelicious food and some seating inside! Shared a plate of giant nachos and we ate it all! They keep the 2 different salsa's in the fridge for you to grab so it's chilled and tasty.
author: Emi G.

description: I love this place. Every time I've been here the food was on point and delicious.
author: Allen K.

description:
Prices went up a lot over the holidays.  A super burrito is $8 now.  This place isn't as good as it thinks it is.  It's decent enough food, but it's not worth that kind of money, and the increases kind of just look like greed in light of the product.

I still live above this place, but I won't go back.  I can walk 1 block and get a better, bigger burrito at Cancun for less money.  Adios Buen Sabor.

And to anyone who thinks this is the "best" anything in SF, you might want to get your tastebuds checked.  I'm not saying any of these places are the "best" in SF, but Los Coyotes and Cancun are both a block away, and both are better.
author: jared c.

description: This place is fully mediocre.  Whoever is calling this epic or amazing must have a serious buzz on and taste buds have become numb.. I don't know what else could be the explanation.  How there is a line is absolutely beyond me.  Seriously nothing special at all.  Bland and completely uninteresting.  Shredded iceberg lettuce, meh cheese, black beans that are completely unseasoned, not so much as a sprig of cilantro (maybe they ran out?).. no lime in sight or anything.  Any reviewer that called the guacamole good has to have a different definition than I do of good guacamole - it seemed to me like it was likely canned; nearly tasteless - look at the photos.. not like any homemade guacamole that I've had.  Total disappointment based on the other reviews.
author: King B.

description:
This place is amazing. The portions are HUGE, the price is great, and what's most important, the food is amazing. I always get the veggie nachos and it never fails to disappoint.

This is one of those places you may walk into and think, "What, this food is supposed to be good?"

No, the food isn't good. It's flippin' fantastic. Eat there.
author: Jenny J.

description:
If you're looking for tasty, cheap eats without attitude or ambience, this is the place to go.  It's the essence of the Mission taqueria:  dive-y, unpretentious, and the employees create an assembly line of Mexican deliciousness, putting together your meal in seconds flat!

I usually get nachos at taquerias:  it's a great way to experience a wide variety of flavors all tossed in a sumptuous heap atop a plate of tortilla chips.  And these nachos did not let me down:  the carnitas were rich with flavor and moist without being too fatty (or the other extreme, stringy and overcooked).  The refried beans weren't too heavy, and the guacamole was a thick, avocado-y puree.  Crema and salsa finished off my plate and made me a very happy girl!

My friend got the tofu nachos and they were also tasty...

Sometimes simplicity and good flavor are all it take to make a perfect dinner.  In a neighborhood packed with Mexican food options, Taqueria el Buen Sabor definitely holds its own!
author: Amy L.

description: One of my favorite places to get great borritos -- I always make sure to get the chicken in the sauce - the green or the red - they are both delicious! I always love going here!
author: Kai-Ashley C.

description:
I only get the Lengua Super Burrito, and the occasional quesadilla, but they're always on-point. The salsa on the tables is delicious, but you're out-of-luck if you are grabbing your burrito to go (yes, they'll give you some in a cup if you ask, no it's not enough). 

I get the feeling that some people, specifically that lovable group of young people which the Mission has become known for, will downvote this place because it doesn't have the same "run-down authenticity" you find at places like Farolito (also 5-stars in my book). Buen Sabor is a little bit cleaner, and its food a little less greasy, than Farolito, which can be a good or a bad thing depending on what you're into.
author: Mike O.

description:
The best part about this place is that they offer tofu as a filling. MEGAVEGETARIANWIN.

Warning - the guacamole isn't my favorite - it's the variety that is suspiciously creamy, like it has sour cream in it or something.

Otherwise, pretty solid little spot.
author: Amber K.

description:
Can't go wrong with this authentic hole-in-a-wall Mexican joint. The food is always delicious and they have a great selection. Even tofu!

No complaints here. It's the best to pick up a burrito and beer then head to Dolores Park.
author: Nicole B.

description:
Oh hey, El Buen Sabor. You've got quite a tasty veggie burrito. Not as good as Taqueria Cancun's, but a very, very close second. In fact, I can't place why I don't like you as much as TC, it's just one of those things, I guess. 

In any case, super-delicious veggie burritos, and their chips beat TC by a mile. Their salsa is a little too onion-y for me to eat plain though. 

But really. Super-good. Try this and Cancun and decide for yourself. Regardless of what you choose, it's a win for you.
author: Stacey L.

description:
This is where I go when it's late and I'm drunk.

I normally get the Al pastor burrito, I love seasoned pork! It's pretty good, I must say. This was the first place I tried lengua tacos and they are DE-LIC-IOUS.  Anyone who hasn't tried it, MUST. You'll be blown away with how good it is. After watching Andrew Zimmern so much, I was feeling adventurous. 

As far as taquerias go, it's hard for me to really hate a place but there are certainly some places I like more than others. This would definitely be on the top 10.

It's a small place and usually really busy. I feel like it's a place everyone can go to and enjoy.
author: Kathryn B.

description:
I always swing by here before heading over to Dolores. I absolutely love getting the suiza steak quesodilla, so simple and so delicious, especially dipped in those salsas they have! My boyfriends favorite is the super burrito. 

The service here has always been great and the people working behind the counter are always nice and get your order right.
author: Tasha M.

description:
Ehh, to many other great places. 

Chicken was full of gristle and tendon chunks.  Non-non existent salsa bar. 

Keep walking.
author: Bruce P.

description: hands down the best burrito you will ever eat. Im not kidding. this is the realest deal.
author: Donkey L.

description: Super delicious homemade tasting burrito. I had the chicken in green sauce and it was fantastic.
author: Martin G.

description:
Watching Rick Bayless on Top Chef, I'm sure many of our curiosities have been sparked about the rich and varied flavors of Mexican cuisine. I know I like what I like, but it's usually a veggie burrito - pretty simple - or some rich delish enchiladas. 

Last week I finally visited El Buen Sabor, and had their tofu in red sauce burrito. It was really yummy. It seems to only hint at the dense and layered spices Mexican cuisine is capable of. I can't wait to try  new dishes~

Tecate, Corona, Modelo, Negro Modelo are sold here
Sits about 12-15 tightly
Cool bench/stool combos to sit on
author: Em L.

description: Favoritest favorite taqueria. Look no further than the carnitas, pair it with refried beans, and be done with it. Tacos or nacho version are advisable.
author: Neera J.

description: Seriously disappointed by the lousy, dries out tamale and flavorless chili rellenos. Stick to the American style burritos and crunchy tacos.
author: Mary G.

description: I came here because the taqueria I wanted to go to was mysteriously closed. The line moved pretty slowly, and it was out the door. I ordered four burritos and they were happy enough to customize all of them. The only issue was that the rice wasn't cooked correctly and therefore the burrito I had was shit. I don't know how you can operate a taqueria and mess up something so basic as rice, but this place did it. The prices are also higher here than other places, but I feel like I wouldn't have an issue with it if the product matched the prices, but they do not. I would not return to this establishment unless all the other taquerias in the area were burned to the ground and I couldn't walk, bus, or drive to another taqueria.
author: k h.

description: Really nice staff and quick service! The food is definitely on point! Also enjoy a pacifico beer when here
author: Yaya L.

description: Perhaps it was because we had been day drinking since 11, or the fact that we just did share plates and half of our party was vegetarians - and I enjoy my dead animals - but with so many above average Mexican restaurants in the Mission this one didn't stand out. Yes, they have decent jugs of margarita and there is a bit of an ambiance compared to other said restaurants, but again nothing special.
author: Makoto L.

description: I have 10 taquerias within 2 blocks from me and this is by far my favorite one.THE BEANS!! I love refried beans and there's are so good. The staff is always really nice and there salsa Verdeis delicious.
author: Colleen B.

description: Rustic atmosphere. Quick service. Good food and generous portions. Authentic Latin cuisine. Very fair price. Good for visiting after drinks in the Mission District. We enjoyed ourselves!
author: I R.

description: We came into the city to play at Delores Park and were looking for a place to eat on the walk from BART.  Wound up here based on other yelp reviews.  Small taqueria but great food. I had the carnitas and carne asada special tacos and my wife had a carnitas special burrito.  They both were very good.  The burrito was great, made especially so by the rice which was moist and flavorful.  Both orders came with chips.  My daughter had a quesadilla but wound up eating off of our tacos and burritos.
author: K J.

description: The carnitas burritos here are worth the trek to this neighborhood. Rich, crispy and moist. The chips are extremely fresh as well as the salsas here. I had a satisfying tacqueria meal here with a price that barely dented my wallet.
author: Derek N.

description: My favorite grilled chicken burrito in the city! If you're in the mission stop by and try it out. Absolutely worth every dollar.
author: Rodolfo B.

description: Went here for the first time yesterday. Had a super pastor burrito. It was great ! You can't really go wrong in the mission when it comes to burritos. Definitely will be coming back again.
author: Mario W.

description:
Great little corner place - my go to for a cheap lunch spot.... about once per week.

They do take credit/debit cards, but I'm pretty sure they charge a $.50 fee to use it, so I always pay cash. 

Usually I get one super taco - they pile that little soft taco shell with a ton of goodness, then give you some tortilla chips on the side. For a small person like myself (I'm 5"2 with a small appetite/stomach) this is enough for a whole meal (i.e. great bargain).
author: Michelle L.

description:
Good things about TEBS (yes, I just abbreviated Taqueria el Buen Sabor):
-it is one block from my house
-it has a "Special" option, which is just like "Super" but without sour cream 
-it has nice looking veggie tofu options
-it has homemade chips and really tasty green salsa

Bad things about TEBS:
-it is further away from my house than Cancun
-its rice is kind of bland
-their chips need more salt

Overall, its my go-to for hangover-curing nachos (even though I wish their chips were saltier) but for burritos, Cancun wins out.
author: Kristin P.

description: The good flavor was exactly that. My pastor special taco (it's got beans guac and cheese) was a monster and without the extra chips there's no way the tortillas it came on could have contained it. Though I've become more of a pastor snob these days, looking for places with the rotisserie thingy which is usually sufficient for good pastor, places like here show that it isn't necessary. Their pastor was rich and a little crunchy. Bomb.
author: Misha T.

description: Aw, man. I love tacos and el Buen Sabor hooks you up with a fatty one.
author: Jocelyn T.

description: I've had burritos here a handful of times. The barbecue pork is okay, the chicken is great, and the shrimp is excellent (although a tad pricy). The service is also really quick. Overall, great Mexican food.
author: Brandon D.

description:
As others have said.... this place has some serious carnitas and steak burritos.  Don't come here thinking you'll wuss out and get a quesadilla or boring burrito.  Go all out. Get the gigantic "award-winning" steak burrito and maybe a plate of nachos to share.  These people don't F around with their burritos.  

This place is cash only... and the ATM was just legitimately not working when we were there so make sure you come prepared.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Amazing super veggie burrito. My #2 spot for burritos. The people who run this place are quick, nice, and make a fan good burrito. I come here all the time!
author: Isaac R.

description:
I live doors from this place and it's my fall back when I don't have anything planned for dinner.  I've always liked it because it's a fair meal for the price.  
I've been away and went in tonight after a few weeks to find that they've raised their prices and gotten stingy with ingredients.  I had my usual "Special" taco al pastor, asked for refried beans.  I was stunned with she very pointedly put all of about a tablespoon on the plate.  Then the cashier put literally just a few chips on the plate.  This is all in contrast to healthy portions of ingredients in the past.    
Given that they've raised their prices again, it'll be a while before I go back.  I'm gonna spend some evenings making some refried beans of my own and roasting a chicken so that I can make my own taco.
author: Unemployed D.

description:
Pretty good. Probably not a destination that I'm bringing out-of-towners to experience the Mission's best Mexican food, but great if you're looking for a quick, delicious and well priced meal. I had the enchilada+taco+tamale combo platter and was definitely more than satisfied.

I'll be back, but with so many great alternatives in the Mission, it will probably be a while for me. 

Dig the divey atmosphere!
author: Peter C.

description: We were in San Francisco about to start our drive to Napa and we stopped here to grab a bite before the trip. I ordered the chicken burrito in the green sauce. It came with chips and their home made salsa. It was okay - not amazing for what they charge.
author: Cara G.

description:
Soooo this reminded me of my favorite Mexican place in Alphabet City, called Zaragoza.  This place was definitely bigger and seemed more "official" (like, their menu was more than a dry-erase board), but their food was pretty authentic.  (Although, IMO... no real Mexican place should have things like tofu on their menus.  That cost them a star.  Sorry, guys.)

Chips and guac were outstanding; they make the guac right there (but not in a trendy way that costs ten dollars).  It's also one of those places that has all the meat in heated tins, which I love.  

As I was full from my breakfast crepe still (see Coupa Cafe - Green Library review), I had the fortunate role of sampling everyone's stuff.  I can't remember all that I had (except for an ice cold Modelo... ME GUSTA!) but it was all fantastic.  

Good tableside salsa, for sure.  Always a plus.
author: J. K.

description: Best taqueria in SF! So I used to go to this place before becoming a vegan. Probably can imagine how much I miss their CHORIZO TACOS! Everyone has to try those!
author: Wendy R.

description:
I visited El Buen Sabor on Tuesday August 9th, 2011 around 5PM.  There was a handful of other patrons in the place.  

I was greeted by a friendly young woman who took my order.  She also prepared my Torta.  I had it with chicken, refried beans, avocado, lettuce, cheese, and jalapenos.  It also came with tortilla chips.  It was around $6.50.  

Good authentic Mexican food.  Quick, friendly service.  Cheap enough.
author: Lindsay P.

description:
The BEST Mexican food in SF!  Hands down, yummm!

I always order the California Vegetarian Burrito with chicken.  Yes, I realize this is slightly odd and I do get a fair amount of weird looks every time I order it BUT it is the best.  This burrito has broccoli, zucchini, rice, beans and I think little bits of heaven as well.  The vegetarian one comes with tofu and though I love tofu, their chicken is so flavorful and juicy it is impossible to not make the swap.

So, do yourself a favor, first order this burrito that comes with chips and salsa, then walk down to the park and get a sunny spot.  Last, but not least, enjoy and thank me later.
author: Kate J.

description: Taqueria el Buen Sabor has just about everything I look for in a Mission taqueria. The food is great and the serving is generous, the service is fast and friendly, and the price is reasonable. And, uniquely for popular taquerias in the Mission, it feels authentic and is not always a madhouse. It is small and can be crowded, but it's also close enough to Dolores to take your burrito to eat in the park. Not much to complain about--definitely worth giving el Buen Sabor a chance as your go-to in the area.
author: Oliver M.

description:
El sabor no es buen.  I badly want it to be good.  It is only a block away from my place.  A full block closer than the next nearest Taqueria.  Unfortunately every time I give this place a shot a regret not making the hike somewhere else.

Cancun is a a couple of blocks away on 20th and Mission.  Do you self a favor and go there.  Or, if Cancun is too far/scary for you, go to one block north to El Toro.
author: Lenza M.

description:
A caveat for this review: I have been to this taqueria more times than I can count but I think that, except for once or twice, I have ALWAYS ordered the exact same thing: the carnitas burrito.

That being said, I will say very comfortably that this is my favorite burrito place in the city.

Here's why:
1: pure flavor!  They use great fresh ingredients and everything is well seasoned and, more importantly for a taqueria, consistent. 
2: structural integrity. I know it sounds silly to have to say it, but if a burrito falls apart while you're eating it, it is a failure. Of all the delicious burritos I've had in sf, this is the only one that has never let me down on this angle.
3: accesories... The chips are always fresh. The two house salsas are excellent and they actually have a great selection of things to drink in the restaurant whether you want horchata or beer.

I can infer (from the few and far between moments that I actually look up from my own burrito at my friends and family eating other things) that just about everything else they serve is just as wonderful...but please...for the love of all things sacred, start with the carnitas burrito. It WILL change you.
author: Gavin M.

description: Still going strong. My go-to carnitas order was excellent. Paired with a Coke (sugar cane), and I was a happy camper for lunch.
author: J S.

description: Great late night spot for Mexican food in The Mission. Yummy! The chili verde taco special is so ridiculously delicious, and they really pile on the goodness. The staff is nice, and the location can't be beat.
author: Tina T.

description:
Burrito especial with.............................Carnitas, please!!

Oh, juicy tender 'carne'!! Hit the spot and filled my up rather quickly. 

Buen Sabor...you bring back fond memories from grad school when I would stop by before or after class to grab a bite. Glad that you are still creating excellent Mexican food on Valencia ;-)
author: Hilda Z.

description: Authentic mexican-american taqueria in the heart of the mission, pretty much as good as you are going to get.  Generous portions, made to order.  Chorizo Super Tacos are the bomb!
author: Justin H.

description:
CARNITAS!! Their carnitas (pork) is amazing. Everything here is good; prices, product, location and options. For the non-pork eaters their beef and chicken is delicious and they have veggie and tofu burritos. I use to come from Pacifica just for their food. 

This is the only burrito shop i go to! Yes, its that good.

btw they have tofu tacos and langua too!
author: Natasha L.

description:
usually, if you're at a taqueria and looking for a good veggie burrito, it consists of buying a standard burrito sans meat, more beans, and voila! veggie burrito.

If you're at Taqueria el Buen Sabor, you don't just get more beans, you get tofu also!

Walking in on a hot sunny day during gay pride, I had to squeeze through the doors with my rainbow fairy wings on and get in line. There are tons and tons and tons of things to choose from. Indecisive I am, I went for a veggie taco, sans cheese and sour cream. With three choices of beans:black, pinto, or refried, there's something for everyone. Super cheap and super good. One order of tacos filled me up just right. Iceberg lettuce is NOT the standard here, but rather actual romaine lettuce. now that's quality! 

I'm all for good food that's cheap. You know you've found it if the name doesn't end in "Bell"
author: Lanie L.

description:
Quite yummy -- especially the made-to-order guacamole. The burritos are nice and mushy. 

Mmm....mushy.
author: Vandana M.

description: They have a burrito that is really on point.  It is perfectly sized.  I have found that there are two types of burritos in the Mission: The babies, like they are literally the size of a newborn child, and The Regulars, while considered large in other contexts, they are actually small in the Mission.  Buen Sabor serves a regular burrito and I appreciate this.  Well, my stomach and colon appreciate this.  I have found the smaller the burrito, the better tasting it tends to be.  The babies are almost always stuffed with extraneous rice and beans, which dilute the other flavors.  And it is important to know that Super burritos are usually never bigger, they just come with more deliciousness inside.  At Buen Sabor, it is essential to go Super.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
This place made me smile, in a city where $7 regular burritos are becoming the norm --DAMN YUPPIES!-- this place still hovers around $6 for a burrito "especial".

The tacos especial are pretty darn big, they don't short you on toppings which is a relief.

The service is fast, they make it in front of you so there is no reason for any unpleasant surprises in your burrito. By that I mean, you can physically observe which meat is the most fresh and choose accordingly.

I was skeptical about the salsa in bottles, but since it's a litmus test I use at every joint I had to try them. The red is great! Good spice and tasty. I've had better green salsa, but this one wasn't as runny as some places, I hate weak green salsa!

Go there if you're in the area
author: Name R.

description:
I had the pleasure of living right around the corner from this place for about 2 years. Needless to say - it was my go to spot whenever I was hungry and needed a quick, cheap, satisfying meal. 

The rice and beans taco or a veggie burrito were my staples. I'm not a vegetarian - I'm just not a fan of meat in tacos or burritos. That said, my friends all enjoy the meat options here.
author: Little C.

description:
If I could give a zero star rating I would!

I do not understand why all these people rate this place so great. 

The food here is some of the worse Mexican food I have ever eaten. My wife ordered a combination plate, the taquito was burnt, the tongue on my tacos was too tough, and the tripas were boiled then an attempt at frying. It failed more burnt meat than fried.  What they charge for the quality is too much. THIS is not GOOD authentic Mexican food!!
author: Frank S.

description:
I don't know much about burritos, but I know that theirs are the burritos I love the most. 

The dinner plates are large enough to serve two normal-sized people, or one super-sized person. I'd suggest getting a plate to share, with carnitas and extra avocado.
author: stephanie v.

description:
I never knew about this place until the ex took me here tonight .. best crispy tacos ever .. tastes like taco bell tacos (you can knock it but I love em) but with super fresh ingredients and tastier ground beef .. the rice? bland ... nevertheless, the tacos are great .. the discovery of this place is exactly why I keep my ex around.

knocking off a star because they screwed up my order twice .. and I was pretty clear when I said "carne asada". I decided not to be a bitch and ate whatever they gave me both times because it was all good.
author: Anvy A.

description:
Best. Vegetarian Super quesadilla. Ever! 
Get it with add-ons: beans, tofu, veggies n avocado :)
author: s.y. d.

description:
Good BBQ pork super taco. Esp good was the fresh avocado. And, the warm tortilla shell.

Edit: Went back and was underwhelmed by the BBQ pork burrito. The guac was gross (thanks Yelp!) and there was a lot of fat in the pork.
author: Andrew K.

description:
4.5 stars - Awesome, this place is legit! 
Waaaaay better than El Farolito, and half as crowded, and unlike Farolito, the salsa is wonderful. Only complaints...they need 2 or 3 more salsas on a bar instead of on the table, and their prices are 1.50 more than farolito...but its well worth it, mmmm mmmm mmm getting hungry!
author: Ben B.

description: The Burritos and Tacos are solid (the chicken is really tasty)! Lots of people are coming through, which keeps the food fresh. The service is fast too. The portions are big, especially the burritos, so come hungry. We usually get it to go!
author: Hanna A.

description:
Carnitas that will make you slap the Latin grandma you never had.

I have some "latin" "friends" that are on very different sides of the Carnitas Spectrum (not to be confused with Roy G Biv).  

1.  Loves the crispy stylie
2.  Loves the moist version

Being that I'm the Carnitas Sun God of the Universe, I have had to eat both types.  Historically, the moist version was the way I went.  Crispy has not done too much for me.  But then I went to El Beun Sabor!

They have the highly coveted hybrid.  This is like Darwin discovering the Galapagos Islands on a trip with Russell Crow.  Nobody does moist in the middle and crispy on the outside carnitas like this place.

That's it.  Go right now.  You heard me.

Don't half step.  If you order anything other than the carnitas dinner plate you will die 1,000 horrible deaths.
author: Brendon D.

description: Superb tacos.Try the carne asada and lengua tacos doused with refried beans (they also offer black and whole pinto)...very good red and green salsas in the squeeze bottles on the table. Grab a Mexican Coke from the cooler. You must try this place when you're in a soft corn tortilla taco mood.
author: Bleep S.

description:
Alright, so the place ain't the prettiest.
And the massive posts that are painted to look like palm trees are a little on the tacky side, but hey. At Taqueria el Buen Sabor yr not payin' for the ambience, yr payin' for the FOOD!

The burritos are very well priced and very nicely sized!
Large enough for me to save half for later.

Also, another plus is that they accept card. Talk about being crazily hungry in the mission and wanting a bomb-a$$ burrito and not bein' able to 'cos you don't carry cash around with you.

Taqueria el Buen Sabor never fails me. 
Check the place out! It's worth it.
author: Jena R.

description: I go here a lot because it's close to Dolores Park. The food here is pretty good and the staff is nice. The nachos are great and easily splittable and the burritos are awesome. This place doesn't stand out a whole bunch, but its sabor is pretty damn buen.
author: Nat T.

description: One of the most delicious burrito spots in the mission district. Very customizable and economical without losing any of the delightful taste. Another perk is it's within walking distance of Delores park so you can take your burrito and enjoy the stunning views of San Francisco
author: Twila G.

description: Bomb super taco--   hit the spot!  This place works when you have that taqueria craving!!  I will be a repeat customer!
author: Stacy C.

description: This place looks like a hole in the wall. And let me tell you, you find some of the most authentic food ever in places like these.
author: Valley D.

description: I hadn't been in here for a few years but I decided to come back and try it out. The carne asada burrito was very delishes. It gave similarities to el Farlitos burrito. Very great place! Tasty carne asada, no fat, tender meat, and the refried beans were authenic mexican made. And the tostada chips were well made.
author: jacobo a.

description: So I went to El Buen Sabor with possibly unrealistic expectations for the first time in 2.5 years. My super veggie burrito was definitely good, the salsa was definitely good, and the chips were good. I just had better at other taquerias on this trip. I will keep it at 4 stars because of my prior amazing experiences, but if this was my first time I would have probably given it a 3. El Metate was better.
author: Seth H.

description:
I was heading towards Dolores Park after a walking tour, Murals And The Multi-Ethnic Mission (sfcityguides.org), when I happened to see this joint. I don't know if it was hunger or in need of a bio break urgently, I gave it a try.

I ordered a fish taco since it was one of their specials for the day.  I was expecting frozen/breaded fish to be thrown in a fryer but instead, the cook threw cubes of raw fish on the griddle which was surprising. 

The fish was really tender and I had to use a fork/knife to eat it. For a $3+ taco, it was pretty big. I tried their red and green salsa with the tortilla chips which came with the taco and they were both tasty.

Service was fast and friendly enough. Their restroom wasn't too scary and their fish wasn't fishy.  For a dive joint, what more could you ask for?
author: Lisa B.

description:
- Excellent Prices
- God damn delicious food
- Recommendations: shrimp tacos, mushroom quesadilla, and california burrito. *drools*
author: Rani M.

description: I am not the burrito guy, since I don't like beans or jalapenos, or the corn tortilla when it tastes uncooked to me, but what I like in taquerias is when the tortilla is fried, and my fav of all are flautas! This place has one of the best flautas ever, she fried them fresh. Tastes Delicious and Real. Not some crispy artificial taco shell, it was a real fried taquito filled with chicken. 5 stars
author: Shadi K.

description:
I was a devoted Taqueria Cancun fan until I was too lazy to walk there one day and wound up trying the little taqueria that could around the corner. 

I'm a vegetarian, and was so pleased to see the California veggie burrito on the menu. When you order it, you can watch them chop the veggies, put them in a pan, and cook them, so you know it's fresh. Plus, I can't get over how awesome it is to have tofu and broccoli in a burrito.

This is absolutely the best place to go before lying out on a warm day in Dolores. Grab a burrito, a Mexi-coke, and if you really have no inhibitions, a pint of toasted coconut from Bi-Rite on the way, and enjoy your delicious afternoon.
author: Beth K.

description:
I was a little nervous about my super tofu burrito because i paid over $8 for it.  I hadn't been here for a couple years, and forgot if I liked it or not.  Again, the price tag made me a little wary, but that thing was delicious, with fresh ingredients, and ginormous.

I was expecting the quality to not live up to the price tag, but it did.  Still a little bit more than I would like to pay, but the chips and salsa were delish. I'll be back.
author: danielle p.

description: Best taqueria in SF. Love the carne asada plate.
author: Ana G.

description: Everyone loves Papalote's and Pancho Villa, but Buen Sabor is the reason to come to the Mission for Mexican food. It is that classic hole in the wall with abuelitas working on the stove making tortillas and asada from love. There is a certain spice that's found in a lot of food around the Mission that doesn't agree with me. I can't quite narrow down this flavor but I don't like it. I've tasted it at Pancho Villa and a couple of other places, but not here. Buen Sabor is truly buen sabor! Es la verdad y no soy mentiroso :) The price cannot be beat and the portions are phenomenal. My favorite thing to do is get 2 tacos that come piled high with meat, cheese, sour cream, lettuce, salsa y guacamole. Pick up a brown bag of tortilla chips at the register and dip those in the taco fixins until I've eaten the taco down enough to be rolled nicely into a mini burrito. Wash it all down with a Pacifico and a Corona and I've pretty much had the perfect night of Mexican. I have been to a lot of places around the city, but this place is the one I boogie on down to from 16th St Bart or when I hop off the 14 at 18th street. Generally I judge a Mexican joint by their enchilada suace, a true craft, and Buen Sabor's is not bad at all, I would stick with the tacos and burritos though to get the most bang for your buck.
author: Jaymie C.

description:
its pretty good. the chips are yummy, my super burrito is packed with yummalicious 

yea, there's many mexican places in this neighborhood but this one doesn't disappoint!
author: Sandra L.

description:
According to my very limited, Chris Farley-esque Spanish, Taqueria el Buen Sabor's name translates roughly into "The Good Flavor Taqueria."

I have absolutely no problem with this place.  It sits conveniently on 18th Street in a wholly underrated part of the Mission.  Its prices are good, its service prompt, and its atmosphere adequate, if not quintessentially Mission taqueriaesque.

But if I were to take a crack at naming this place appropriately, I would go for Taqueria el Mediocre Sabor.  Use some spices already!
author: John S.

description:
I'm going against the grain with the three stars, and maybe it was just an off night.

I had the carne asada burrito in an effort to consistently order the same burrito in my quest to find the best burrito in the Mission. I was pretty disappointed. After hearing about this place from two different people, I was excited for a better burrito than the current reigning champ Cancun. There is potential for el Buen Sabor, but my burrito was cold in the middle for the overflowing amount of sour cream that they put in, which made that part inedible. That also brings me to my next point that the ingredients weren't evenly distributed and made for a very different tasting burrito from one bite to the next.

I'd go back to try the chile relleno or something else, but the burritos better be left to Cancun.
author: Amanda D.

description:
A bit pricey for a divey kinda place. I had to pay $10 for a shrimp burrito. To be fair, it was quite big and could have been eaten as two meals. The burrito was tasty but not the best that I've had.

They also charge a fifty cents fee for credit card usage regardless of amount spent. I was not warned of this until after they had already swiped my card. 

Also, I am used to getting complimentary chips and salsa at taquerias but here, you have pay extra for that.
author: Mimy P.

description: Now that I live in the East Bay, there is a hole in my heart the size of a Buen Sabor super veggie burrito. Nicest people, best food. I do, however, resent being charged for extra salsa. C'mon my spicy food loving hermanas (yep, only the ladies charge me extra!)...don't be stingy with the salsa!
author: NB S.

description:
I'd give this business 2 and 1/2 stars if possible.  Which is unfortunate because I really wanted to like this place based on the prior yelp reviews.  I went in to get a burrito for take out this evening- super burrito with chicken.  

I walked in on a Friday night, and they took my order right away.  Unfortunately, they took it so fast the dude walked away before I could even finish my order (which was approximately a 10 second order, so I wasn't asking for much of his attention).  I had to call him back to finish my order, and he then walked away *again* before I could finish.  At the end of the day, this doesn't really bother me too much- if you're expecting good service, you shouldn't be going to a hole in the wall burrito shop.  Then somehow this $7 burrito on the menu cost $9 when they rung me up (last I checked our sales tax plus healthy SF fee isn't ~30% so I don't quite get that).  But ok again... $9 isn't going to break the bank.  The upside to this place: the time for me to walk in the door, order a burrito, pay, and be out the door was under 3 minutes.  

Then I actually ate my burrito.  Very mediocre. I have no idea how other people like this place so much.  The chicken specifically in my burrito was very strange- tasted like some funky chorizo.  To be fair, this is my first time, so perhaps this is an acquired taste (?).
author: Peter B.

description: I have been going by the place since the early 80's and I finally tried the food tonight. I had been wondering for a long time if they were any good. I found the food to be mediocre. The nearby competition for Mexican food is fierce. I can't see any reason to go back there, but at least the mystery is solved. I do think if they remodeled the inside to look a little nicer they could increase their business with all the hipsters in the neighborhood.
author: Andrew W.

description: The portion is big as expected, ordered a steak dinner plate good for 2 not-so-hungry people. The steak was thin sliced, grilled just right, tasted very good. There was an older Spanish speaking man on wheelchair and the lady came out to take his order, pretty good customer service. However, while we were eating, a random Asian homeless-like guy came in, mumbled something and then looked at us. He tapped my spouse's arm and keep mumbling, I think he might speak Vietnamese. We didn't understand what he's speaking and he noticed right away and then went to another person by the ordering table. After like 2-3 minutes wandering in the store without anyone talking to him, he left. I was shocked the cashier lady didn't come out to escort him and just pretended there's nothing happening and keeps taking her order. I understand where I was and it's like a nature to see homeless man wandering in stores, but still it was a shocking experience. Food was ok for 4 stars, -1 star for the staffs not dealing with this coincidence.
author: Fatima L.

description: Cheap, fast, and delicious.  I come here all the time.  Al Pastor is my favorite.
author: Jacob A.

description:
