This used to be my favorite taqueria in town, and it's still a good value, but things have tapered off a bit.

Their red salsa in bottles in still very good, as is the green, tomatilla-based variation, but it used to be a lot chunkier back when it was in the bowls.

The salsa made these burritos awesome - now they're just good. One other thing I've noticed is that the meats are a little drier these days, so the burrito contents stend to be a little more dominated by the texture of the rice.

All that said, this is still a solid option, and I'd recommend it. It's just not an elite taqueria.
author: Owen R.

description:
I've been making the rounds at the taquerias and have to put this one on the lower end of the spectrum.

Their tofu/veg burrito is bland and flavorless (I'm an omnivore, before you ask) and it doesn't have to be. 

Half a dozen other tacquerias can get it right (see El Toro, Papalote, La Cornetta, Casa Mexicana, El Castillito, etc.)

The chips were also kind of ho-hum.
author: Joel P.

description:
So I've been here more times than I can count for quick low key dinners.  And for some reason, on the two occasions where my friends and I decided to try some hypey new restaurant things in the Mish (read Mission Street Food and The Corner), we've also stopped here before or after for a tide-me-over taco.

After a dinner at The Corner this past weekend, my 100 pound friend was like, I want a taco.  OK, let's go get a taco.  El Buen Sabor was on the way to Creme Brulee Cart's locale for the night so we stopped in.  Now I've always gone for the chicken or beef tacos here, but tonight, we were feeling adventurous.  

Lingua it is!

What a great call. So tender, plenty of beef flavor and with the guac and salsa, it was this tantalizing, perfectly balanced, salty, acidic moist pile of taco tastiness.  I'm not ordering anything else here ever.
author: Audrey T.

description: Yummy, yummy burritos. It's also close to the park so you can just grab it and go. We stopped by here on our way to meet some friends at Dolores Park - it was quite tasty and the perfect size to share. We got the super. Just make sure to get plenty of napkins because it gets a wee bit messy. The prices are pretty good too.
author: Amy J.

description:
The al pastor passed the test.
The crew wanted to go to Yamo's but it was closed.  TEAR!
So we had to settle for something else.
This place came through in the clutch, it was close by.

Al Pastor burrito was tasty with a slight kick.
The size is definitely smaller then El Farolitos, but it was still filling.
They have seating, about 18 seats.
You have to be buzzed into the bathroom and ask them for water.
I'd come here again.
author: Po L.

description: After my first carnitas super burrito at el Buen Sabor, I'm hooked! They do carnitas right! Big enough to split and avoid the burrito food baby.
author: Chrissy L.

description:
The best taqueria in the Mission. Taqueria Cancun comes in at a very close second, but the green sauce here is what sets it apart from the rest.

Plus, it was right around the corner from my apartment.
author: Kristy H.

description:
BEST NACHOS AND TACOS IN SAN FRANCISCO.
The nachos here should be featured on some sort of amazing food show or given an award. For a really reasonable price you get the most massively glorious heaping plate of deliciousness. I recommend with chicken, but they'll make it to order. You can easily share with others. The art with which they distribute the ingredients is breathtaking...I'm talking every single chip is weighed down with toppings...none of that one-blob in the center and all of the other chips nude as can be nonsense you get elsewhere. I have lived in the Mission for years and I take all of my out of town guests here. I am such a Mexican food aficionado that I've rated my favorite burrito elsewhere...this is the place I nominate for best nachos and tacos. 
I'd also like to credit the staff with being so friendly and diligent and all around good people. I was once there and some drunken people came in and procedded to throw up on the floor before even ordering...then one girl screamed "CLEAN UP IN AISLE 5!" and they all walked on laughing. One of the nice guys working there came over and cleaned it. In that moment I saw the best and worst of SF...cheers to the staff at Buen Sabor! And next time you throw up in a restaurant, pick up a napkin please.
author: Virginia W.

description: Great Food - little overpriced for the mission but that is what you get for being on Valencia.
author: James S.

description: It's very hard to find good Mexican food in San Francisco, but this hole-in-the wall spot has the right stuff.  The tacos are American-style, i.e. bigger and more stuffed.  One or two "regular" tacos should be more than enough to fill you up.  Different Mexican beers are available: Modelo, Indio, etc.
author: A R.

description: Being super picky about Mexican food because well I'm Mexican this place hit the spot before a concert at Elbo Room but wouldn't be a place I'd go back to or crave. Everything was simply done and had nice seasoning but nothing to write home about. Good to catch a couple tacos or a burrito and I definitely preferred the al pastor to the carne asada.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
This place lives up to it's name.   Had a grilled chicken super burrito and it was enough for two people.  I love it when I have Mexican and you can taste how fresh the ingredients are, and this place did not disappoint.  

One thing I love about it is the authenticity factor - while I love Pancho Villa, it feels sort of Disney-ish - this place felt authentic and real, the service was friendly, and the place was kept clean.  I'd definitely go back.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Yum. I've tried the vegetarian, tofu, and chile relleno burritos. All huge and tasty and extremely filling. No need for lots of cheese or sour cream either. 

Totally possible to split one between two people as long as you're not starving, which makes an extremely cheap meal.
author: Robyn M.

description: Best. Carnitas. Ever. Rich, salty, porky goodness, with crispy fried edges that make all other carnitas seem like mush. The tabletop salsas are also pretty delicious. I wouldn't say there's anything special about the other items, but the carnitas are so good that I'll continue trekking across the Bay to savor them.
author: Monica S.

description:
this place has THE BEST CARNITAS HANDS DOWN!

hella juicy AND crispy all in one..

burrito or taco, you won't be dissapointed.
author: fina a.

description:
Me encanta!  

I ate a black bean burrito in the car and it leaked all over my sweater and pants.  And when I say all over, I kid you not.  I mean big freakin' mess.

When I arrived home, it looked like I had returned from the kill.  That's how my husband really knows when I've enjoyed my food.  When it's smeared all over my freakn' face and clothing.  I can be such a slob.  My toddler has nothin' on me!

Back to the food.  I got the Mr. a black bean burrito with pollo verde and the works, minus rice (why have rice in a burrito?  I don't get it!).  I got a simple black bean burrito for myself (I had nothing left when I got home, but mooched a couple bites of his, just for research purposes).  

One thing I like about this place, as opposed to some other taquerias, is that the person who takes your order is the person who makes your burrito.  The benefit to that is if you say you just want a little bit of cheese, you might actually get just a little bit of cheese.  At other places, they don't qualify "little" - it's just "cheese" or "no cheese."

Parking sucks in this neighborhood, but you don't have to park for long to eat here.  And if you want to walk, you can look on Guerrero or over near Dolores Park.

The employees are very nice here and this is one of my favorite taquerias when I want to go for the burrito kill.  I should just remember to wear old clothes so I don't stain any fancy attire.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I used to always go here and loved the food! Lamentably, my body didn't seem to have a good reaction to this last time. Was it me, or the food? Lol. I'm fearful of it happening again so I think I'll air on the side of caution and not order from them again.
author: Lisa B.

description:
so GOOD! There's nothing I like better after a night of dancing than this place. One night the girl preparing my food saw that I was pretty drunk and started speaking to me in Spanish. While I feel like I forgot everything I learned, I busted out some decent Spanish with a perfect accent. That's the magic of this place.

Oh yeah, I love the food. I don't like my Mexican too spicy, but I like a little. This is perfect. Forget all the other little Taquerias, this is the one to go to. Cheap + Slightly Dirty (for authenticity) + Delicious.
author: Ryan V.

description:
Came in here and committed to buy a tofu burrito, but somehow "Chile Relleno Burrito please" came out of my mouth. Lapse of consciousness I guess, but fortune was on my side. Their Chile Relleno burrito is one of the best vegetarian burritos I've ever had. Definitely top 2. The chile relleno is light and fluffy and the flavor is heavy on the egg. Really nice. Give it a shot. I have. Three times. Awesome. 

BTW, since you're in the area, checkout Selfedge across the street and find out what Japanese denim's all about. What's up SuFu!
author: David G.

description: Chicken Burrito with rice, cheese and guacamole. So good. Don't mind if I do.
author: Shanna T.

description: Ordered the Beef Super Burrito and Chicken Super Burrito.   One short scoop of Beef and Chicken.    Not very flavorful and short on quantity.   Should have know better than to go to somewhere other than Pancho Villa.
author: Don M.

description: Bomb!!!! I love the food here. Everything is super tastey. True authentic  Mexican food and they are open till late night
author: A C.

description:
With all the great taquerias around, it's hard to pick just one.  I usually end up at Taqueria el Buen Sabor because it's right next to my house...and because of their California Veggie Burrito.  They cut up the raw veggies and stir fry it in the pan for you right after you order (it's not sitting in one of those metal boxes being heated all day), so it's super hella hella super hella fresh.  It also comes with tofu marinated in a  yummy tomato sauce.  

They don't even yell at me when I bring my dog in, unlike Taqueria Cancun.  They spoil me.  Now I want mushrooms, zucchini and broccoli in all my burritos!  As Busta says, "wooha."
author: Sid D.

description: Best chile relleno burrito in the city! & vegetarian rice and beans : )
author: Sara D.

description: El Buen Sabor is the anchor of my Mission restaurant rotation. The burritos taste authentically Mission Local and are well priced. It does the job every time.
author: David C.

description:
mmmmmMmm Burrito! 

I love this place.  They make their burrito right. I always get a steak burrito and never once has my steak been chewy.  The rice is flavorful and the guacamole is delicious.  I also love the fact that they give free chips and salsa, for some reason this is no longer a common courtesy at taquerias.  They also give you two kind of salsa/hot sauce.  A green one and a red one.  I personally like the red one better, I guess it's because it's not too spicy and has a hint of sweetness to me.
author: Mimi P.

description:
I've been fussing about wanting the perfect nachos for the past couple of weeks but didn't want to trek to the Mission for 'em.  Instead, I went to other local places, which admittedly don't suck, but their nachos do.  Squandering my nacho quota on subpar renditions... meh.  I wish I would have sucked it up earlier and came here.

Every time I've been here, they have crafted the absolute gold trophy in nachos.  I swear, the nachos are like a labor of love.  They skillfully lay out the chips, ensuring all chips have equal opportunity for toppings.  They don't just glob on the ingredients in the middle of the chips, they tenderly dab and dollop the toppings.  It's the perfect balance of cheese, meat, salsa and beans.  It makes me want to sing from a mountain top.

My companion suggested that he wished there was more cheese on the nachos and I had the thought to punch him in the throat, but then I remembered he was my boyfriend..  and they're just nachos.  

Ironically, the word about their nachos is out.  The guy in front of us ordered nachos, and did the 4 other people behind us...

Oh yeah, cut the staff a break and clean up after yourself.  The bins for the plates and trash are right to the kitchen.
author: Mary P.

description:
There is nothing wrong with this place, but I was hard pressed to find anything right with it either. The burrito was fine, but lacked some of the flavor you get at other places within a couple of blocks. 

Big minus in that they don't have a salsa bar. WTF?
author: Jason R.

description:
The leanest Al Pastor I've ever had, yet it's still greazy and delicious. 

Flautas...I've eaten them everywhere and these are amazing. Crispy as the dickens and buried in gooey toppings. 

Ground beef w/peppers & onions...this is basically your moms taco meat w/o the Lawrey's or MacCormick, only actually better...nothing pleased me more than taco night at my house and when I spring for the $6 taco dinner here and get the ground beef in crisp shells, it's heaven. Or try it folded for a Hambur-rito.

The burritos here are kind of  "wet". Think, "the opposite of El Farolito". Start with an Especial burrito if you can live without sour cream. Also, this is so not me, but I had the grilled veggie burrito. It was like a huge soft egg roll with beans and I call that somewhat macking. 

They make your chips here. I've seen them do it. Home-made chips of any quality are better than the stale, nasty bulk-bag chips they serve at Farolito and Cancun.

Finally, stay away from the pollo asada. It's just not very good, unlike everything else I've had here
author: Jeremy W.

description:
Not bad, not bad at all.

This place although a whole (yes, whole not hole!) in the wall, serves good mexican. You can get all your standards, and the quantities served always outweigh amounts that most people can usually eat in one sitting. So it's good for left overs as well. 

But being mexican I wouldn't let it sit and eat it more than two days after the fact (if that.)

Yes, yes, I've gotten what I've nicknamed the: "Buen Sabor Bathroom Hurricane" a couple of times, but I'm latin, I work it off and keep coming back for more...

So if a little food poisoning isn't your thing, maybe this isn't your place. But for some quick and dirty mexican with a "hot" sauce that's more mild, this may be your place.
author: Carlo F.

description:
Mmm, mmmm, and mmmmmm.

I'm officially a convert.

Usually if I go to a taqueria near my office, which is right at 16th & Valencia, I'll make a trip to El Toro (at 17th & Valencia).  I still stay strong that El Toro rocks but today it has met some serious competition.  My coworker surprised us all by bringing in food from El Buen Sabor to celebrate Cinco de Mayo.  Since I'm vegetarian, I couldn't scoop anything from the chicken or beef platters.  However we had a large container of rice and multiple smaller containers w/different choices of beans.  Plus there was fresh green and red salsa to add.  The rice and beans, as simple as it sounds, was sooooo good!  I had three plates, I couldn't stop eating!  Also someone from our office brought a jar of pineapple salsa from Trader Joes and mixed with the two fresh salsas from El Buen Sabor, it was food heaven.  

From my coworker's honest endorsement, El Buen Sabor gives really good portion sizes for a better price than other neighborhood taquerias.  

I'm sold.
author: Swetha G.

description: Yesss, lunch time. They always put up with the handful of ridiculously specific orders I throw at them every day on behalf of my co-workers. Good food, great portions, friendly service considering they're always slammed when I come in.
author: Konrad P.

description:
Can't really contribute to anything that hasn't already been said.  Awesome chicken burrito.  Kick ass super tacos (honestly, they fill me up quite well).  And they won't kill you either!

http://www.dph.sf.ca.us/eh/Violations/Loc_CurrentViol.asp?LocationID=1296

Not sure Taco Bell can claim as much.  Taco Bell killed my dog.  True story.
author: Chris M.

description:
I live in San Mateo every time I go to san francisco I do not forget to go through the TASTE GOOD TAQUERIA excellent care of food preparation excellent burrito, tacos, tortas, quesadillas.tostado, chile relleno
I give them all 5 stars
author: Gerardo D.

description:
Taqueria el Buen Sabor is perfect for chile rellenos burritos, which they precook, then grill for you upon order, and the flautas are a delight.   I think they're a little tight with the meats in the burritos, but you can order it with extra meat if you want...but beware!  You're burrito will officially become "expensive" with extra meat.

Very friendly service and nice local feeling earns Buen Sabor a solid 4-stars.

UPDATE:  Okay, I've since learned that here is where you find great carnitas.  They scoop up a heapin' helpin' and throw them on the grill for you as they prep the burro.  And they ain't skimpy with it, either.  Also, the tacos are generous, inexpensive, and without all that pesky rice.  !Perfecto!
author: Randy F.

description:
Well, I'll be damned. 

Just when I thought I'd tried the best burrito in the Mission, my friends introduce me to El Buen Sabor... and buen sabor it is. I got the Special and learned that its name is not (merely) due to the added guacamole, but is rather an accurate and fitting adjective for the warm, fuzzy feeling this little burro produces in your satisfied stomach.  

I recommend you don't use the restroom here, however, since it may just put you off the food entirely. Crowded on weekend nights, which is an excellent sign, and absolutely worth the wait.
author: G. J.

description: got the super veggie burrito.  it came with beans, rice, sour cream, guacamole, lettuce and beans with a side of tortilla chips.  i thought it was good and the burrito was big.  i think id rate this place between three and four stars.  the prices here are very reasonable.
author: Amy L.

description:
Eating a burrito when I bit into a ROCK and almost broke my teeth.  ROCKS in burritos!!!!!!


ROCKS IN BURRITOS!!!
author: john s.

description:
They serve breakfast burritos ALL DAY LONG. This works out great when you sleep until 2p on a Sunday. 

Not that I would know what that's like.
author: Jill C.

description:
The name says it all!

I can never decide between the carnitas (when you order it, they fry it up and it's so good!) or the lengua (love me some tongue!).

Las comidas son muy ricas y los trabajadores son amistosas.

A mi me encanta el burrito de carnitas! Que rico!
author: Keau K.

description:
This happens to be the closest taqueria to my house and I have come to love it.  I'm not sure about all the others around because I only go here and to Puerto Alegre when I want margaritas with my food.  This place has always been great, except the time I brought a out of town guest and she got the last of the BBQ pork because I told her how good it was, that sucked.   
I think they run out of  it a lot because it is do damn good. Go early, for lunch so you can get some!  Green salsa is amazing too!
author: Jocie H.

description: 3.5. Wandered in here serendipitously with my friends. I don't usually like Mexican food, but the quesadilla I got was amazing! Look forward to coming back.
author: Alexei B.

description:
I know many a folk who don't want to try the goodness that El Buen Sabor has to offer, but they are missing out. The services is great (family owned and operated) ,the food is tasty  and they even help me with my espanol. The taco dinner plates are more then filling and being from the Midwest I can always go for a crispy taco. It's a great place to share a nacho lunch with friends, the super nachos are so big you better hope you have a friend to help you finish them off (ask for extra chips on the side so you can scoop up every bite). 
 I think they blow El torro out of the neighborhood!
author: B. Rabbit m.

description: Great tacos, giant tasty burritos. Kinda hot inside, but that's because a major heat wave just hit the bay area this past week! Get salsa and sour cream on yer tacos. Sooooo gooood.
author: Sharee R.

description:
It's the nearest taqueria to me, and, oh, how I wanted it to be good.  My experiences, though, have been very disappointing.  Lettuce in a burrito is always a concerning sign, and it's doubly odd when that burrito pretty much sucks.  I remember it being bland and sad.  The guac was uninspiring, and the chips didn't make me do the electric worm either.

They're friendly enough, though I tend to get an unusual number of crackhead shakedowns outside the joint (not really their fault).

It's always packed, but I just don't get it.  I'm chalking it up to a brilliant location and moving on to El Toro or Cancun (or the other 15 reasonable taqs in the area).  Maybe they have excellent vegan carne asada?
author: Brad S.

description:
My favorite taqueria of the moment. I've been here a few times, but it finally settled in last night. I will admit that a tofu burrito never sounds like a good idea, but it really, truly is the BEST idea. The tofu is marinated to perfection and tastes perfect among the beans, rice, salsa and avocado. And FINALLY a vegetarian burrito that is hot throughout! I hate biting into a cold burrito - it's just not fair that most veggie burritos lack the warmth of a flesh filled version.

LOVE the squirt bottles! Both sauces are spicy and friggin' delish. 

I ordered the veggie quesadilla (which I probably wouldn't order again) but for junk food, it was great! There are no veggies (unless you consider iceberg lettuce nutritional) except for some salsa, and it's covered in creams (guac, crema, AND cheese - not the most healthy choice). It tasted really awesome after a long day of Christmas shopping. 

Credit cards accepted! That's nuts! Bottled and canned beer, plus a fridge full of sugary drinks and gas-station-esque horchata/juice machines.
author: Brittany L.

description: Hands down, the best taqueria in the Mission. Their chorizo is amazing.
author: Sgtslut F.

description: Havent been here in awhile. its good but Ive had better...it will be a minute before i come back =/
author: Monique E.

description:
I'm here to review Taqueria el Buen Sabor (i.e. The Good Flavor Taco Shop) but really, specifically, the hard shell tacos. 

It might seem incongruous to get a hard shell taco at a nice Mission taqueria like Good Flavor but hear me out. There's a certain, comforting charm to the preformed nested hard shell taco. It's two parts junior high cafeteria, one part Mom's "taco night", and 7 parts crunchy-mess delicious. Sure, they're like 2.25 times as much as a Taco Bell taco but Taco Bell hard shell tacos have a soul siphoning emptiness to them that carries a higher toll than that $1.46 can hope to replace. 

All the other food here is just fine, especially the 50's diner style squeeze bottles of tasty red and green salsa ("rojo", "verde" right right). But shit man, sometimes a gentleperson needs a couple of delicious crunchy "home-style" hard shell tacos wrapped in that worthlessly thin restaurant foil. 

so there.
author: Milk N.

description:
Always used to go here when I worked around the corner and was only disappointed once - when I ordered refried beans in my burrito (they were cold). Other than that, I stuck to chicken burritos and veggie burritos with whole beans and loved it. 

Taq. Cancun is right around the corner and that is a very hot spot, but it is like comparing apples and oranges. Cancun is very much a quick and inexpensive, very much taqueria style food and atmosphere. Sabor, on the other hand, offers higher quality offerings with a bit higher price tag and a little more chilled out environment. Not much fancier, but it doesn't have the taco stand feel to it that Cancun does. 

If you want to try a good quality, slower paced taqueria check out Sabor. Of course, if you are in the mood for an excellent, super authentic taco stand type taqueria go to Cancun.
author: James B.

description:
Cinco de Mayo 2007...
House party in the Mission bordering Potrero Hills...
Leave party to go to the Lexington...
Walk down Valencia in search of burritos...
The first two stumble in and get in line, the 3 of us catch up and 'click' door is locked right before we get there.  *panic* followed by *pounding on the door* and yelling 'carne asada!!!!'.  One of our friends comes and unlocks the door warily and lets us in.  We get in line and ignore the dirty looks from the people on the other side of the counter.  
We hear a loud *THUD*...I turn to my friend and ask "was that B******?"  "No way" she says.  I take my veggie burrito and go over to the tables.  I ask B******, "was that you that made that loud noise?".  Drunk and laughing she says "Yeah, I fell over and hit my head on the floor!" Hahahahahahahaha.  

Oh the memories...

One more thing, I really liked that they had some hella (yeah, I said hella) old certificate on the wall that they won for 'Second Best Burrito" in the Mission.  Congrats.
author: jen n.

description: Delicious cheese enchiladas and re-fried beans can be had at Taqueria el Buen Sabor. The rice is just alright. I must withhold stars for both the small size of the enchiladas and the major financial goof by counter intelligence. My dinner plate plus soft drink totaled $11.97. I was charged only $1.27 and told to write in the rest as a tip. Uh huh. I took a bottle of Sol instead of a Jarritos from their fridge to make up for it.
author: Camille K.

description: This place is a fine example of a good taqueria. Nothing special - no salsa bar, the chips are pretty good but not awesome - but they make a damn fine carne asada super burrito, and their table salsas aren't bad. You could do far worse than have a meal at el buen sabor.
author: JR H.

description:
Why do you need nine employees at a time at a taqueria that's dead most hours of the day?
No clue.. But the nachos are good, burritos are blah, tacos are passable, meat sorta sits there for a while.
But sometimes you don't feel like walking to Cancun, so fuck it, you eat at El Buen Sabor and you watch nine employees make one burrito.
author: Kiya B.

description:
Okay, so it's not good, per se.  The meat's usually been sitting too long, and the guacamole's way too thin.  

And it's true that if you're here, you're mere blocks from lots of other, better taquerias.  But those places have long lines!  Lines with lots of people in them, people who have questions to ask about whether or not the pollo asado is vegan or if that's organic cilantro.  Those bastards aren't standing in your way at Buen Sabor, because Buen Sabor is kind of crummy.  And that's why I go there.
author: Christian C.

description:
As a vegetarian, there are few taquerias that really stand out for me (papalote exluded). I mean, I pretty much order the same thing everytime, or at least similar variations of the same thing: beans, salsa, cheese, guac, lettuce. No sour cream. I love me some tacos, so I am not complaining whatsoever, but when I find an exceptionally good taqueria it tends to be, well, exceptionally good.

So here comes El Buen Sabor. I can get a super vegetarian taco (no sour cream!) for three bucks.  With black beans, which I'm totally into. They dump some mediocre chips on top of your plate and call it a day. Right away we know it's cheap, but it's also huge! The taco fixins' pretty much fill my entire plate and it's not all lettuce. I'm way into that.

However, the important point to be made is this: the table salsa absolutely rules. It's red and garlicy and smooth and spicy and mixed with cilantro. Tastes totally fresh and not overpowered by onions. The garlic comes forth clearly and yet meshes with, rather than murdering, the other ingredients constituting the foundation. I love this salsa. For reals. Lemme tell y'all a secret: sometimes I use most of the jar on one taco. And by sometimes I mean all the time. And it's a decent sized jar. It's just that insanely good.

I'm knocking off a star because the taco's good but not mind- blowing, and once the salsa was far too mild for this lady's spicy tongue.
author: Chloe S.

description: It's a decent place to get mexican food :) It wasn't anything super amazing but it gets the job done. Had the tacos; they were very filling and the carne asada nachos were big and looked delicious but we didn't like them enough to eat them. I'd probably go again to try something else but it will be a while.
author: Heidi G.

description: El Buen, what happened? Rob and I felt terribly betrayed. Your cheese was not melted and far from generous. The pieces of carne asada were bacon bits in size and cardboard in taste. I can't go on. I told you baby you were the best quesadilla I ever had - why'da have to go and soil a good name? Was I wrong about you all along or did we just have a bad day? Please, don't make me have to wait for El Far. She's a sleazy burrito whore.
author: Emily T.

description: Don't get me wrong...their food is AMAAAAZING! I'm from San Diego where delicious mexican food runs rampent, so I'm super picking about my burritos. These are some of the best that I've had. However, I was really put off by the service and the stinginess. I ordered two burritos which cost 17 freakin' dollars...btw....AND I left almost a $2 tip, which I never usually do, but I was feeling nice. So I was really ticked off when they handed me my one bag with a bunch of smashed chips and two burritos. Then when I asked for an extra salsa, the chick at the cashier said it was 25 cents extra! I told her that I had just thrown all my change  into her tip jar. Still she wouldn't surrender an extra salsa. Just sad and ironic considering they have squeeze bottles of salsa out on all the tables if you dine in. I know this isn't a reason not to go there, but I'm mad at them and this the how I take it out. I will totally eat there again....DUH, but no tips and I'm considering swiping one of the squeeze salsas...shhhh.
author: Christy T.

description:
El sabor es muy bien!!!  

I've only been here once and it was to grab burritos before heading over to Dolores park to see an open air film!  This place was close by and was perfect for an impromptu nutritional pit-stop. Cheap too, less than $5.  Note that there is no salsa bar to speak of though, if you're into that.
author: I. O.

description: In a neighborhood full of excellent taquerias, Buen Sabor is one of the best. The salsas are simple, to the point, and delicious (plus they are not stingy with them like other places). I really like their carnitas and the chile relleno burrito.
author: Heather H.

description:
I had a taco here and it tasted a bit different from the usual tacos I get from other taquerias. This one had a bit more flavor. I liked! Plus, they were quick at making it. I was in and out within five minutes.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
I've had better and I've had worse.  Basic menu.  Basic place.  Nothing stands out but food was good-not great but good.  Cheap.  Friendly, efficient service.

These things (mediocrity and all) make this place waaaay better than places like overrated La Taqueria.  Proof that just about every taqueria serves up better and cheaper tacos and burritos.
author: M M.

description: The super-V vegetarian burrito is damn tasty. Super filling, warm and wrapped in a delicious, fresh and chewy tortilla. I enjoy their thicker chips and salsas. They have bohemia, a mexican beer I love, a++. I wish their guac was better, just tastes like avocado with cream or something, give it some flavor and texture!
author: Cori W.

description:
When my boyfriend and I lived in SF, we'd go out of our way to get our burritos from El Buen Sabor.  They are just so perfect.  All of the components are distributed evenly throughout the burrito, so every bite is full of amazingness.  

I once had a two hour layover at SFO and decided to fill those two hours with a trip to El Buen Sabor.  I once skipped out on work in the middle of the day to have a burrito from El Buen Sabor.  I have an 8x10" photo of El Buen Sabor hanging in my kitchen.  Seriously.
author: Phoebe M.

description: Damn this was a great burrito. Now admittedly, the only other SF burrito I've had has been in the Castro, so I have nothing to compare it to. My only complaint is that it got a little runny towards the end, but I just assumed that meant the carnitas were juicy. Also, this place takes credit cards unlike 3/4 of the rest of the Mission, and they were pretty fast. Will definitely be going back and trying the rest of the menu.
author: Beth D.

description:
Discussing Mission taquerias always lends itself to some kind of battle royale or hostage standoff, so I'm not going to chat up El Buen in comparison to all the others in the neighborhood. 

Basically, I love El Buen Sabor because I made up a song about it (to the tune of Morrissey's "Mexico"), and singing on the walk down there puts me in a good mood.
author: Raquel M.

description:
I'm here a lot because it's close to work.  Definitely less expensive and less out of the way than La Taqueria. Their prices are very reasonable and the people are usually pretty friendly.  I also like that it's so small and chill-- everyone's just there to eat and talk.


-The tamales are only $1.50!  Should I be saying this here, will they raise the price?  I love it because if I forget lunch, I know I won't go broke here.
-I really like all their food, but once I had the carnitas and they were really dry, so I always tell people to get anything else.  From the other reviews here, though, my carnitas experience seems to be isolated.
author: Miranda T.

description: Carnitas was nice in crispy from the grill. Bonus star for bean choices. I like refried and black bean combo. And salsa on table in squeezy tubes-genius. Just don't think about who was touching it before you. Might want to wrap a paper napkin around the outside of the bottle. I just straight up went for it, bare handed. I roll with wet wipes in my bag for moments like this.
author: Ahna P.

description: Really good. Better than expected.  Pico design Gallo salsa was fresh and tasty.
author: Jon M.

description:
The most delicious Carnitas torta ever! One of the best places to eat Mexican food in the mission. When I was pregnant I could eat here everyday. Wait I'm not pregnant anymore and I still want to eat here everyday! 

Everyone I have brought here to eat is now addicted and even my brothers girlfriend who's family is from Durango, Mexico says it's incredibly authentic to that region. 

I'm in love.
author: Jessie J.

description: Decent prices and a good burritos. The salsas are great but there isn't much selection.
author: Thomas C.

description:
This place was great! I had two lengua tacos and an al pastor burrito. The tacos were on small tortillas, but were rather big, and most delicious. The burrito was amazing. My girlfriend got a chicken burrito, she fell in love as well.

Not only was the food amazing, but they had this guacamole salsa, stuff on the table that made everything ten times better. They had a great selection on the menu too.

There were two things I would have changed. The menu said they had Menudo on Saturdays and Sundays. We were there on a Saturday, and I love Menudo, what could go wrong? Well, apparently they have Menudo every Saturday, EXCEPT for this day. A sad event for me. Second, they were a little stingy with the chips.

Overall though, a great place! Great food, great prices, and a great selection. I say go for it!
author: Nick R.

description:
FOOD:   I've tried their grilled chicken and carne asada special burritos and if you're looking for something that tastes ok but will fill you up then you've come to the right place.  The portions are generous, but the carne asada burrito was a little dry and salty.  I also think that the quality of your burrito depends on who makes it.  The grilled chicken which was made by the lady who works there was WAY tastier than the carne asada made by one of the men who works there.

SERVICE:  Fast.

AMBIANCE:  Your standard taqueria.

OVERALL:  eh.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
I've done my share of taqueria tastings, as all San Franciscans have.... I've gone to my neighborhood spot, and all the hyped-Mission District places, but I really like el Buen Sabor.

It may seem decadent, but I am loving their Chile Rellano Super Burrito.  The chile has great flavor and when it melds together with all the rest of the Super Additions... heaven.  

My dining partner, Arnold, is addicted to their tortas which hold the meat (pick a meat, any meat) so perfectly on their buns as the sauce slowly seeps in.
author: Karen W.

description:
Totally delicious and consistently fresh.  It's my new favorite that is within a 10 minute walk of my house.

I recommend a mushroom + broccoli quesadilla or crunchy chicken tacos.

You may need to ask them to go easy on the cheese for the quesadilla otherwise they just assault the poor thing with it.
author: Ankur P.

description:
just your quality burrito shop. they have what looks like mabo-tofu, but i've never tried it.

not a bad lunch burrito spot.
author: Ameer N.

description:
Major points for being less than one block away (yes sometimes sloth does win over). Solid burrito, strong ingredients, reasonable quality, excellent staff. But overall satisfaction just lags behind the two-blocks-away Taqueria Cancun.

Good al pastor, not too greasy yet flavorful. Great ground beef crunchy tacos. Poor grilled meats which are pre-grilled and get cold and rubbery. Strong veggie burritos (ask for avocado over guacamole) and a respectable pollo verde.

It's really close and I like the employees so I go there. When out-of-towners want to be wow-ed by mission burritos, I go the Cancun.
author: Hiten P.

description:
Super tofu burrito how I miss you!  Your gooey marinated tofu insides mixing with normal burrito fixings to create a lovely brick of comfort in my stomach.  Sitting at the counter looking at the old school pictures on the wall.  Trying to open a beer bottle and having beer fly everywhere and having nobody get angry at me.  SF - it's all good.

One of the best burrito places in the Mission.  It probably doesn't get the respect it deserves because its too close to the Castro/Noe Valley to be central Mission, but oh so good.
author: Tullia F.

description:
"I was born at General Hospital in San Francisco  and lived in the Mission for a while after college.  THIS IS MY FAVORITE TAQUERIA of them all!!  I LOVE IT.

My favorite thing to eat is a SUPER CHILE RELLENO BURRITO - holy hell it is FANTASTIC.  I want one right now."

BUT - I must say - one time I got black beans instead of refried and they have a "different" rice for those who come off as "healthy"  -  this alternative rice is not good.  Since then I have only ordered the refried with the normal rice and it makes my day.
author: Taryn O. M.

description: Fantastic burritos, good price. Veggie burrito's are great too, with the veg cooked to order. If we want a burrito we always end up here.
author: James M.

description:
Since this place is about 50 yards from my front door, I have been here on more occasions than I would like to admit. 
The steak quesadilla is delicious and the steak tacos are good. The burrito - uhh well I wasn't all too impressed.  

Great Mexican beer selection
Nice staff
Open till midnight?!? 
On a few nights when I've stumbled home before last call they were open but definitely not after....
author: Jason R.

description:
Best local burritos in the Mission.  We're surrounded by decent options, and we've sampled enough of these Burritos to know they're top quality.  

Can't go wrong with the veggie burrito or the super chicken (key: order chicken boiled in the red or green sauce) and ask for no sour cream or just a bit.

Mexican dinners we've ordered here haven't been the best, but stick with the burrito and you won't be disappointed.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
This taqueria is solid.  It's good, but it's not spectacular.  

I didn't like their refried beans cuz it was runny.

The black beans and pinto beans are good.

The chips are really thick, crunchy and greasy.

i don't like how their guacamole is really smooth.  it's like a watered down avocado smoothy.

The mushroom quesadilla is pretty damn good.  it doesn't taste like mexican food though.

The shrimp quesadilla was average.

The nachos and super nachos are average.

Out of all their burritos I like their vegetarian burritos the best.  Veg, super Veg, or Californian Veg. burritos.

Their flan is pretty good.

Their horchata is good.

Their tacos are pretty good.

All in all, the food is like 3.5 stars.  I'm going to subtract 1 star though, because their food is so freaking expensive for a taqueria.  Even if you just order one thing, don't expect to get much back from your $10.  So I'm left with 2.5 stars, but I'm going to add a half star and give it 3 stars total because they accept credit cards, which is very nice if you don't have cash on you.

I forgot what else I got from there.  I live extremely close to this place, so I always come here when I'm feeling lazy.  When I don't feel lazy, I just go to taqueria cancun.  It is sooooooooooo much better, imho.

edit: i sound like I love vegetables too much in this review... when in fact I don't like them very much.  I love my meats: pork, beef, chicken, turkey, buffalo, etc.  But this place makes some great vegetablized mexican food that I love to eat.  I just wanted to clear that up so you, the reader, can make a better judgement call on my judgement call.

edit:  I just weight one of their super burritos.  756g = 1.67 lb!!  that, my friends, is a massive burrito..
author: Jung L.

description:
I love Mexican food... Like... Really love Mexican food...

Their are better Taqueria's in the area, but honestly this is a 5 star Taqueria...

I work across the street. I stare at their giant TAQUERIA sign 5 days a week... Myself and the others i work with have been exploring their menu for years now i have to say we have found some gems..

For starters i love the blend of flavor in their burrito's between the salsa, rice, beans, cheese, sour cream, guacamole, and whatever meat it goes together phenomenally.

Their super Queso's are like GIANT Crunch Wraps.... (In a healthier, and much more tastier way than Taco Bell).... They toast it up and it gives it great flavor and texture.

I love the tamale dinner plate there and also their Torta's..

I could describe it all to you in this review or i can sum up why you should eat there quickly.

1. Prompt Service (You can order a burrito and have it in your hands warm within a few minutes)

2. Really cool people (Everyone there is nice and is very helpful)

3. It may not be the best.... But its right there and no one does Mexican like they do... 

4. I have eaten their easily once a week if not more for the past year and a half... I have not gotten sick of it and i rarely go anywhere else because in my opinion they have the best Mexican within a few blocks...
author: Joe W.

description: Mmmm, the mission is the place to be for Mexican food my friends.  Check out this spot before heading over the Dolores park and saw that it was a decent rating.  Were my fellow yelpers right?  Why yes they were.  Hallelujah!  I had the chicken super burrito and the chicken was charboiled and flavorful.  Every bite was packed full of flavor.  My date had the shrimp soft tacos.  The shrimps were cooked perfectly, still juicy and not overcooked.  The chefs know their meat well and boy, I am not lying.  Check out this little corner gem in the Mission.  You won't regret it.
author: Janice F.

description: Fantastic little taqueria. The staff seem to care a lot about the preparation and presentation of their food. I ordered tofu tacos and guacamole, and was surprised (and thrilled!) to see that the guacamole is made fresh right in front of you! You get a good size container of it and a bag packed to the brim with chips for about $4.50. Amazing value and delicious, would definitely go back!
author: Kat M.

description: best chile relleno you will find!!!!! you have GOT to try it!!! sooo delish it reminds me of how my mom used to make them :)
author: Liz C.

description:
No No No. In a city with a seemingly endless supply of avocados, there's no reason to used bagged, creamed, neon green guacamole. I don't get it. Granted, I had a veggie burrito, so maybe this is a place for the meats, but guacamole this bad speaks to the overall caliber of the restaurant. Worst burrito I've had in San Francisco. Absolutely, the worst. Don't eat here. Go to Cancun or El Torro instead. They're both within blocks. Yegh. 

p.s. I gave two stars because the salsa in the squirt bottle on the table was actually pretty tasty. I doused my burrito in it, which unfortunately also added to my heartburn ...
author: Von D.

description: This is my go-to spot for lunch. Awesome burritos and really good red sauce. Cards accepted. :)
author: Casey S.

description:
i was starving and low on cash wandering in the mission (no cash = dead in the mission) hours before i had to be where i had to be and do what i had to do. 

i came in just to get out of the cold. glancing at the menu i saw a delightful taco i could afford so i got it with some chips.

DUDE IT WAS LIKE A MOUNTAIN OF TACO! with the chips i had nachos and tacos. 

fuckin love the shit out of this place.
author: krispee o.

description: carnitas tacos are the thing.  a lot of noise about burritos from yelpers.  Burritos are really for take away.  taco is the unit of food by which mexi places should be judged.
author: e c.

description:
El Buen Sabor was my first 'San Francisco' Taqueria experience four years ago when I was visiting a friend from New York.  Needless to say I was enchanted by the incredible potential of burritos to be *so much* more.  I'm happy to say that after living in San Francisco for two years my abiding love for El Buen Sabor has endured, even with the many excellent burrito options readily available elsewhere.  

I've tried most of their menu but I always go back to their Super Carne Asada Burrito with black beans.  It's the best I've had.  They use cream instead of sour cream.  I heart the Buen Sabor.
author: Billions S.

description:
Used to be my neighborhood burrito joint when I lived in the Mission, and I still  come here to get my burrito fix. Simple, filling, and well-spiced. I don't know how they do it. It looks like nothing special on the other side of the sneeze guard, but somehow by the time they hand you a rolled-up aluminum log, the flavors have melded together to a little (or rather large) piece of joy.
Also, I know it's uncool to be squeamish about sanitation, but I am. I admit it. This place has a 94 on Public Health review - awesome.
author: GS M.

description:
What can I say? This taqueria has quickly become the favorite of myself and my friends. There are plenty of choices here in terms of menu items and ingredients. The service is prompt and cordial (language barriers aside), and the food is generally delicious.  I can personally vouch for the chips and salsa also. The chips are crisp and tasty while the salsas are equally good.  I definitely recommend eating in so you can get unlimited access to the red salsa that comes on the table. While sometimes there is a bit too much cilantro, it is generally very well made with a sort of smoky after taste. Go for the burritos, crispy tacos, and my personal favorite, the breakfast burrito (which they will serve you at all hours of the day!!)

Delicious.
author: Joseph B.

description:
Lovin' this place for cheap great lunch. 
The Super Taco seems to change a little everytime I order it. Sometimes with rice, sometimes not. Like it with black beans, and carne asada or pollo. It's packed high with guaca, tomato, cheese, sour cream and I smother it in spicy green sauce.
The burritos here are banging too, but real big. I do not recommend keeping the left overs till the next day. I did this once and it smelt real nasty. Which makes you wonder...hmmmm. Then you stop, don't worry about it and go back in a get another one.
author: MissSkip Z.

description: OK seriously this place is gross. i went here on accident (a friend told me to go to el toro but he told me the wrong cross street so i went here because i didn't feel like looking around) and got a burrito. i couldn't even finish it.
author: Geoff B.

description: I appreciate establishments that allocate time to what usually seems to go unnoticed. Chips fall into this realm. At Gordos and El Farolito, chips cost extra, fixing their status within the taqueria as merely supplemental (but the burritos here are so good, limiting distractions is totally fine). At Cancún down the street, the chips are sometimes cold and taste sortof ready-made. This may seem like no big deal, because it isn't, but it's important to appreciate the idiosyncrasies of El Buen. Their tacos are a big deal and their burritos are totally alright but honestly, their chips are amazing. Fresh and not too greasy and thin and other adjectives that imply chip perfection. Also here's some background on me: I eat tortilla chips every day.
author: Sam R.

description: Definitely one of the underrated taquerias in mission, but this is a good thing as it is often overlooked by tourists! This place is phenomenal.  I have been going here several times a month since I was very young and have barely ever waver from my special carnnitas burrito.  All of the other options that I have tried are excellent as well.  Its absolutely the best!  A family establishment, the owners are wonderful and the prices inexpensive for the massive amount of food.  A great locale, I have yet to find a taqueria that exceeds El buen Sabor, however many do come very close.  The flan is excellent as well.
author: Alexander R.

description: Not bad, not bad.  Tasty green sauce, good rice, and fresh vegetables.  The chicken was tasty, but kind of tough.  Not the best Mission burrito I've had, but far from the worst, and a few bonus points for being walkable.
author: Angela B.

description: Good solid mexican food. Tasty hot pico de gallo  and good vege options.
author: Tamrin H.

description:
Stopped by El Buen Sabor as my first experience at that Taqueria was okay. I placed an order for a super vegetarian burrito and was excited to taste the multiple flavors. I was disappointed! The burrito was mediocre, nothing really stood out in my mouth to make me truly remember El Buen Sabor. I doused most of my bites with the mild red salsa available on the table, at this point it really did not make a difference. Perhaps it was just that day, but I believe an authentic salsa should compliment dish flavors. Both green and red were more on the bland end. After several bites I decided to throw away the remaining and vowed to invest my gold coins elsewhere.

Burrito: Nothing spectacular, bland and watery (from the almost liquid-like guacamole.
author: Jamie S.

description: This is just your standard, delicious Mission-style burrito. It's not the most amazing burrito you'll have, and it's certainly not a destination taqueria, but if I end up again in a spot where it's the closest one to me and I need burrito sooner than later, I'll go.
author: Mark A.

description: Always a great spot to grab a tofu burrito to go and eat in the park.
author: Tamar N.

description: It was just about lunch time when I stumbled on this place (I love living in the Mission!!). I ordered a regular burrito with Al Pastor. Delicious, fast and cheap!! What is not to like?
author: Lee D.

description:
I was looking for the newly reopened El Toro, but my poor sense of direction had me wandering in circles. Hungry and cold, it was a welcome sight when I saw the sign for Buen Sabor.

I had been here before and considered it above average, and I think I had the chicken burrito, my standard. But tonight I went with the california veggie, and this mix of fresh grilled veggies (watch the butter), tofu, beans and salsa on a wheat tortilla was simply delicious. Enough so to earn another star.

Of course I passed El Toro on the way home, but I'm glad I had the chance to give Buen Sabor another shot.
author: Jason B.

description:
A-OK.

That's surely how I would describe it. For some reason, I've been hesitant to try Buen Sabor. There is just so many taquerias around. So so many. Buen Sabor got lost in the noise of burrito goodness. 

Last weekend I finally made my way over and got a California Burrito - lots of veggies, tofu, and beans. I'm 99% sure it's vegan. I'm not vegan, so I asked for cheese. 

It was tasty and I actually didn't feel bad about eating a burrito. It was also $7 and change. In my opinion, that's kinda pricey for veggies and beans. 

I'll be back to try the other goodies though.
author: A K.

description:
Buen Sabor isn't much to look at, but she's got it where it counts.  

I used to eat here twice a week while interning in the Mission.  Their carne asada platters give you a lot of food for the cost.  My favorite thing on the menu though is their enchiladas.  The salsa is great and they have a great selection of beverages, including multiple flavors of Jarritos and Mexican Coca-Cola.
author: Rachel B.

description: No me gusta. Con tantas taquerias buenas en este vecindario, no hay excusa para patronisar esta taqueria.
author: Maria D.

description: Good, but a little arbitrary with the dispensing of chips.  Why does he get chips with his order and I don't?  Perhaps I'm stumbling drunk and he looks oddly sober for 3am?  Or perhaps it's my squinty-twitching-lazy-drunk-eye?  Still... why don't I get any chips?
author: Christine M.

description: This is my favorite overall taqueria in San Francisco for three reasons: 1) their salsa rocks. It's a must if a burrito joint is even gonna be a contender; 2) they prep the meat in small quantities so it's always fresh; 3) it's family run, brothers and sisters making your food with love! If you want a veggie go to Cancun, if you want crazy shrimp and shit go to Pancho Villa, but if you want a damn solid and delicious pollo asada burrito then El Buen Sabor is your place. I love it, I love it I LOVE IT!
author: Dave B.

description: Of all the many taquerias of this style in the area, this one is by far the best.  The ingredients are super fresh and the prices have stayed reasonable over the years.  Head and shoulders above El Farlito, Azteca, et al.
author: Michael D.

description: One super taco makes a good cheap lunch. One of my favorite taquerias.
author: Peridot G.

description:
this place is okay and it'll hold you over till you can find a proper burrito. everyone was pretty cool and it wasn't that expensive. but i wouldn't tell any of my buddies to go here.

p.s. i heard a fart in here that sounded like they had a whammy bar hooked up to their butt
author: Mike L.

description: This place is so great-- when classes at New College a block away got out, we used to go down to eat together at this taqueria.  Often, it would be the highlight of a depressing and dismal day.  My roommate and I often go here when he gets off work too-- a great end to a long, tedious day.  I really recommend it if you want a cheap, good taqueria!
author: James S.

description: El Buen Sabor es la mejor taqueria en la Mision. They've got all the good standard stuff, but also offer specialty meats such as tripe, tongue, and stomach lining. Also love the stuffed pimentones and their tasty horchata. Buenissssimo!
author: Will R.

description: I had the carnitas burrito.  It's pretty tasty here.   Always passed by this place but never been before but I'll try it again.  Obviously, don't go for the atmosphere, but the food seems pretty decent.
author: Mitch A.

description: I recently got into the vegetarian nachos at Taqueria el Buen Sabor. They are just GREAT! The ratios of ingredients are right on, and the chips are quality-smooth and crispy-the good kind. The portion is huge, so you can definitely share with someone and, man, that'll be one cheap meal for the both of ya'll! Probably not the healthiest, but hey, i'll make it a monthly thing.
author: Shannon R.

description: I got a super burrito the size of my forearm, and washed it down with some cinnamony Horchata drink..hells yea-- tasty stuff
author: John P.

description:
Oh how I've missed you now that I live in the East Bay.
Your pollo asado is pollo perfecto.  

Thank you also for letting me practice my mangled Spanish skills.
author: Yoni L.

description: Everyone has their favorite taqueria, and this one is mine. What takes it over the top for me is not just their burritos -- which are spectacular -- but the rest of the menu. The tamales are great, the taco plate comes with guacamole and sour cream standard, they have tons of drinks to choose from, and their chips are freshly made in-house. And the salsa? Red and green; both are hot, and both are very flavorful. Nothing watery here. The only thing I find myself wanting are radishes and pickled carrots on the table, but that just gives me a reason to try something else and not come here every single time I want a burrito.
author: Casey C.

description: Very disappointing.  I had two tacos: al pastor and pollo asado.  Filling in both were cold (well room temperature).   Maybe the steam table was broken, but cold taco fillings are not what I want.  Al pastor seasoning was not as flavorful as it should have been.
author: Julin M.

description: With all the competition in rive hipster of the Mission, I'm startled this immobile taco stand is still in business. No salsa bar, C-grade carne, stale ambiance, and not just one but three long black hairs in my burrito. You don't have to travel the world to seek blatant health code violations when you can go straight to Taqueria el Buen Sabor. Como se dice "Yuck"?
author: Hoppie B.

description: When I said that La Cumbre was the only taqueria worth a shit in all of San Francisco, I forgot about this little gem that consistently spits out a good meal at a super decent price. Plus, there is never ever a line here. I think that's because there aren't a bunch of white kids with dreadlocks asking how they can get a veggie menudo or some other assorted nonsense.
author: Stan B.

description:
i had such great hopes for a san fran taqueria. maybe too great.

my burrito definitely wasn't bad, but it was about the quality i've come to expect from a chicago taqueria. i liked the variety of beans and salsas but the meat just wasn't overly impressive. i tried the carnitas super burrito. it was super large, but not super flavorful.

for $6 at an 'order-at-the-counter' sort of place, it fit the bill. i think i was just expecting more.
author: Rachel P.

description: This is, hands-down, my favourite taqueria in the Mish. Despite always being busy with patrons taking part in delicious Latin faire and definitely not always cool on warm days/evenings--I walk the extra few blocks from BART to eat here. I typically order either Super Nachos with Chicken or a Special Burrito with Chicken. Both have always been fantastic. Some of the ladies even add extra chicken and cheese to my Nachos because I don't have everything that comes with the Super Nachos. I've also tried their Super Burrito with Chile Verde and Chicken. The chicken is moist and well-flavoured and their Burritos always seem to be warm all the way throughout versus cold, limpy cheese in the middle like you find at other places in this price-range. So, if you're looking for a modestly priced, well-flavoured, taqueria that's quick and clean, try El Buen Sabor.
author: Christian D.

description: At least three different people have brought me here, pimping it as their personal favorite. I'm not a local girl, so I can't speak to how this place measures up in the taco turf wars. What I can say, is that it gave me my burrito fix. It took me to the carnitas promised land, and I am a believer. Amen.
author: Greycella L.

description: I'm giving 5 Stars solely for the Green Chicken Burrito.  The Red Chicken Burrito is also great.  I know there's a more correct name (pollo en salsa verde), but they know what I mean when I order it.  Big chunks of roasted white meat chicken - no mystery dark fatty chunks here!  If you like beef tongue, tofu, or carnitos, I'm not going to make the bold statement that these are the best burritos in the city.  However, if you are a chicken kid, this is your spot.
author: Michael M.

description: A day at Dolores Park is not complete without their vegetarian super burrito. Coming from San Diego, I swore off SF Mexican at first but this place converted me. My perfect day in SF consists of a sunshine-filled, beer and Buen Sabor picnic at Dolores.
author: Lauren C.

description:
best burrito and tacos within a two to three block radius of work. two to three blocks being the max i can walk from my office before getting all antsy pants feeling like suddenly i am wasting precious time.

point being, if you like sauteed veggies, you will love their california veggie burrito. i like to get mine with guac. i also really like their bean tacos and was super into the tostada salad thing for awhile. i am not so into their chips, as i like mine lighter and crisper.
author: julia r.

description: The veggie California burrito is full of cooked vegetables and really tasty...even for a meat eater like me, it's really fulfilling (good with avocado added also). I like the brown rice and tostatas too.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Possible some of the best red and green salsa in town.  These folks are always sooooo nice and sweet, if you can bust out the spanish you are in for life.  I love the suizas w/ carne asada.  The whole pinto beans are superior as are the burritos.  I am a traditionalist.  Skip all the lettuce and frills, go for meat bean and some chesse maybe salsa inside too, but that's all.  I will drive all the way across town to go there when the craving kicks in.
author: Nicole F.

description: EVERY TIME i go here, i am never disappointed with what I get.  They are more affordable than other taquerias in the area.  The chicken verde here is awesome, too.  Never a big wait.
author: katie p.

description: Can't say I have tried all of the little taquerias around the mission, but this is my favorite. It is inexpensive, they give you good portions, and most important for me, you don't have to second guess the quality of ingredients going into your burrito/quesadilla. I love that they also give you many different options of spicy salsas that they automatically put into whatever you order. For something cheap,easy, and delish, this is my stop.
author: charlie A.

description: This humble little joint makes some pretty great burritos, so I've been coming here for years. They have a good variety of ingredients (I usually get the grilled chicken, carne asada or al pastor) and tortilla types (spinach is my fav). Best of all, there is never a big line and they are very reasonably priced. So what's not to like?
author: BR K.

description: I had a multi-day recording session in the area and made it my point to find the best burrito joint in that part of the Mission.  El Buen Sabor took the bean filled cake.  Their refried beans just ROCK which make a big difference (assuming you are getting refried instead of whole beans).
author: A. Tobias T.

description: They don't call it Buen Sabor for nothing!  I just finished the best Super Chile Relleno burrito I've ever had.  It was absolutely marvelous.  All of the individual flavors inside this urban food log melded together so, so, so well... and yet each was still distinctly enjoyable on its own.  The relleno in the heart of the burrito was neither greasy nor overfried; not crunchy nor limp... it was simply perfect.  And the relleno was not the entire filling either; there was still a delicious 30% or so of beans and cheese in there.  Mmmmmm.  I don't think I can imagine a better chile relleno burrito.
author: Eric O.

description: Ordered the carne asada burrito with spicy salsa. This isn't the best Mission burrito by any means, but its a Mission burrito which puts it way above most other places.
author: John B.

description: Best carnitas in town. Best red salsa in town. Taqueria Cancun and the rest of those over-hyped cess pools are just eating their dust!
author: Adam F.

description: Had the super quesadilla suiza for lunch yesterday.  I could have fed a small family with what I was given.  Thumbs up all the way around.  Great carne asada and salsas.  And the chips were fried in-house.
author: Nathan W.

description: Love this place for lunch. I can get in and out fast. The staff is efficient the food is fresh a good. I especilly like the healthy options like the wheat tortillas, brown rice and I think the best tofu in ranchera sauce!
author: Anthony L.

description:
This is my favorite taqueria in the city, and it's ironically the first one I ever went to when I visited years ago. Many taquerias in the mission throw the cilantro around; but if cilantro takes like soap to you (or worse), you'll probably love that this place doesn't inject it everywhere. I've never had a bad experience here, the people are super nice, and they encourage me to practice my Spanish in a way that doesn't make me feel like a jerk.  

This is also insanely key: they know how to roll a burrito. I don't mean like, "Hey, welcome to [insert McTaco store name here]. I have some foil and I'll turn it into a crumpled metal bag around your sloppy food log." No. No, I don't mean that. I mean like, "Hola, I am about to make sure your food stays hot and delicious by creating a perfect, intergalactic foil cylinder of amazingness for you, because I am awesome and know what I'm doing." That's what I'm talking about.  If this place went away, I would starve.
author: C S.

description: Cannot be beat for very cheap burritos bigger around than my calves.
author: Jude F.

description: Yum, the perfect spot for when I'm cravin' nachos and they don't skimp on the guacamole!!
author: Jenn O.

description: This fantastic ghetto-fab taqueria will serve you up hot chips, a big fat warm tofu burrito, plus tasty sugary horchata for under $10 in under 5 minutes.  Their jukebox was super fun with the entire Selena catalog.   This was my first time here.  My expectations were super low and the burrito definitely exceeded the decor and lighting which might scare off less brave souls.
author: Kyle T.

description: pretty much getting used to the standard SF mission taquerias now, most are very similar.  standard meat pre-preps (carnitas, nicely salted, then lightly heated), al pastor ok.  tacos $2.40 with beans.  not the same as a special prep like los gemelos RWC handmade tortillas.
author: Rob C.

description: Even though I went back to eating meat several years ago, I still order the tofu burrito here because it's so damn delicious.  I often find myself craving them and have even traveled into the Mission for the specific purpose of obtaining one.  My boyfriend has eaten various chicken, beef, and pork items off the menu and has been extremely pleased with all of them.  As with most taqueria burritos, the portions here are extremely generous and could possibly be split into two meals.
author: Katrina J.

description: Had a burrito, was okay, basically this is the mission and there isnt anything special about this place. Its good but not that good to go back.
author: Vanessa N.

description: Lengua super burrito. Mild salsa. No cheese. I didn't expect to receive heaven in a foil wrapper, but that is exactly what I got. They serve one of the best burrito's I have ever tasted, and that is not an easy thing to say. I grew up eating el farolito, but hot damn, I wish I would have had el buen sabor earlier. They serve the perfect amount of rice, beans, and meat, so that you're burrito is actually a meat burrito, not just rice, beans, and a sprinkle of meat. And the salsa is SOOO good! And what I love about this burrito (which some people don't), is that the next day, after putting my leftovers in the fridge overnight, it gets a soft, soggy tortilla that just SCREAMS "dip me in salsa!!" Please go here, right now. Please. I promise you, it'll be REALLY good.
author: Deena H.

description: Good, cheap, consistent burritos. Not the best burritos I've ever had, but I've never been disappointed here and I go here quite a bit. Everything is always fresh and the horchata and chips & salsa are top notch. A rather unkown gem on Valencia with a clean shop and friendly staff.
author: Michael E.

description: Not a bad taco. I like that they have an intermediate "special" level between regular and super, that just adds cheese and guacamole, which is how I like my tacos. The grilled chicken quality is good. Spicy salsa could be spicier, though.
author: Tom H.

description: Stopped in today for lunch to get a super carne asada burrito. I was happy with it, although my expectations were a little high, having watched Anthony Bourdain's: No Reservations - Mexico episode this morning. It was a good size though, portion controllable (enough for lunch & leftovers), very tasty. Mine had rice, meat, guacamole, cream, lettuce, tomatoes, and salsa. The carne asada was good but not hella good. Wish I'd gotten the carnitas now though, based on the other reviews!
author: Trish A.

description: The nachos easily weigh in at more than 2 pounds.  Probably not a better value to be had in the city.  Hey, it is the Restaurant of Good Taste after all.
author: J R.

description: Nice little taqueria in the Mission--seemed like the clientele leaned more towards non-Hispanic than the other way around. The burritos were huge, hit the spot for hunger. Service was quick and great; my sister and I just had trouble understanding them from time to time. x_x;; Oops!
author: Helene K.

description: Ordered two burritos. They both smelled like B.O. Seriously. Es no good.
author: Andy L.

description: Good quesadillas and tacos, best eaten with the great Mexican pineapple juice. Close to the 16th/Mission BART station.
author: Ryo M.

description: An acceptable taqueria, with reasonable prices and gut-busting burritos (this is an embarrasing but serious inclusion). Hey, and they have a bathroom that is surprisingly clean.
author: Shannon V.

description: Normal price for a burrito that was not that great, all bathed in cheese Mexican music. Do you want the real deal ? Go to Taqueria Cancún nearby and ask for a burrito mojado, compadre. Then compare and you will tell me. You will see the difference. Although I must admit that I have a thing with parts of life that are 'mojadas' ...
author: Javi V.

description: The best Taco in town.  Get the carnitas or carne asada super taco with all the trimmings. If you want a burrito then head around the corner to Taqueria Cancun on 19th and Mission and get it smothered.
author: Raymond M.

description: "The Good Taste" and is it ever.  This is my favorite taqueria for nachos.  I don't know why, but they're so damn good.  Plus, the portion is *huge*.  Definitely enough for two people.  Their veggie burritos are good too.  And rumor has it that there's no lard in the refried beans, so this is a good stop for vegans.
author: Napoleon R.

description: I've only had the taco, but what a taco it was.  The carnitas were fresh and tasty -- just the right amount of salt and cooked just right.  The chips were on par with other trustworthy taquerias.  The tables were clean, the lighting was good, service was quick and it's within crawling distance from the Elbo room.
author: Jay M.

description: Buen sabor, indeed.  The flavors are good.  The name doesn't lie.  The pollo asado was perfectly prepared.
author: Tim G.

description: Of all the places in the Mission that I can go get a burrito, I tend to go here. I always get the same thing: Regular tofu burrito with pico de gallo and the green salsa. It is really tasty and the sauce that the tofu is stewed in is yummy!! Also they are one of the few places left that actually gives you chips without you requesting them or getting charged for them. My Japanese friend loves this place because she can get ground beef burritos. My boyfriend tends to think ground beef in Mexican food is sacreligious and goes for the carne asada. All in all-everyone I take to Buen Sabor leaves full and pleased. Lastly, the people who work there are always friendly esp. if the music is bumping from the jukebox. So bring some change for some tunes.
author: Gina c.

description: THE BEST taqueria in the mission.  period.   my mexican grandmother said her tamale was the best tamale she has ever had in her life.  and she's old.  best burrito in town.  i love the green chicken super burrito or steak quesadillas.  fast and friendly service.
author: Natalie H.

description:
passable flavor = misleading name of "el buen sabor"

+ seriously unusual GI distress. (and I do not have a weak stomach at ALL)

avoid this place and wait till el torro reopen
author: G Z.

description: Not bad, can't remember what I ordered, but obviously it's not that good. They're nice there though so I'll often stop by and get a taco. Not bad.
author: Gina R.

description:
by far the fastest burrito i've had around these parts. in the door and out, burrito in hand, in like 3 minutes. seriously.

oh and its damn good, too!
author: Dan M.

description: 5 stars seems a bit extreme, yes, but this place hasn't disappointed yet.  Been there half a dozen times and always left stuffed and fufilled.  Food is tasty, servings are plentiful - I don't trust a taqueria that maes a burrito that doesn't stuff you (cough cough el toro and la corneta).   Not open as late as other taquerias (some better, some worse), but el buen sabor isn't lying, and they will serve you a ton of delicious food for a decent (although I'll admit not dirt-cheap) price.  Currently in the lead of my "best veggie burrito in tha Mission" - helped along by it's wide selection.
author: Tmon B.

description: Most delicious pork tacos around! The decor is nothing to write home about, but this is by far the best tacqueria in the Mission in my opinion
author: Ana W.

description: This is one of my most favorite taquerias in town.  Not only is it super cheap, but it stays true to its name.  I can't live without their crispy tacos!  Who doesn't love a tasty 4 dollar meal?
author: Aggie R.

description:
there are 94370956757689 taquerias in the mish
how the fcukkkk can i possibly determine which is best?
i dunno. i guess this place is el buen sabor.
but definitely not el scrumptioso. 
its near dolores park. thats a bonus.
Christine M. is right. there IS arbitrary chip dispensing. 
they have V8 in the cooler. thats good.
i guess i have to find an EPIC place to use
as a measuring stick for other places.

to a random asian guy like me, its all the same.
author: JT X.

description: Great Grilled Pollo Burrito!!!  I especially like their Salsa Verde (there seems to be a bit of extra guac in there as well).  Add cilantro and onions to the burrito and you're set.  The only down side is they only pass out one salsa cup on togo orders and they don't give enough chips.  But I'm a repeat customer and will continue to go back.
author: Bhavesh M.

description: One of my fav taquerias in the city. No frills, just darn good burritos. I pretty much always get the special burrito w/ chicken. Get it w/o rice so I don't feel like such a cow after eating the whole thing. Puts a huge smile on my face EVERY time...which is at least once a week :-)
author: Gregory G.

description:
This is BY FAR, the best burrito I have found in San Francisco.  After living in San Diego and searching for the "the perfect burrito" (so far like 12 places in the mission), el Buen Sabor is the closest thing to perfection.


Reasons the burritos rock:
1. always let me order half pork/half pollo asado...the pork gives it a really great extra flavor.

2. If you like spicy, the jalepenos are really tasty without being crazy hot  

3. the refried beans rock!  

4. This place used to be one of the cheapest burritos in the mission, but realized that everywhere else was charging more
author: Lance T.

description: Love their tofu burritos - one of  the only places that actually has that on the menu.  Great bang for your buck - huge burritos for nothing.  Definitely recommend getting the "super". Service is great and really quick even though there's almost always a line.
author: Angie K.

description: I love this place!!!!  After a day in Dolores or a night at Cassanova / Delirium, this joint always always hits the spot.  And they're keepin it real and not tryin to get all CLASSY and remodel like El Toro (who upped to "classy" prices as a result).
author: Stephanie W.

description: I work right around the corner so I go here weekly. LOVE the shrimp taco and vege burrito. Great place there is something about this place that the food has more spice than the others in the neighborhood. I walk past Pancho Villa to eat here.
author: julie q.

description: Very consistent burritos that are about 20% cheaper than those at El Toro, Pancho Villa, etc.  I'd recommend the green chicken, especial, black beans, picante sauce.
author: lawrence c.

description: You have to go to specific taquerias for different things. One place won't do everything right. I go to one place for carnitas, another for carne asada. One for chorizo, one for shrimp. I used to live around the corner from el Buen Sabor for years and they have my favorite SHRIMP burrito in the mission. That's why the four stars- on the shrimp. The sauce is delicious and it's gigantic. I get extra sauce. iI definetely don't like getting  my horchata out of a machine, though I usually end up getting one anyway.
author: D. E.

description: I have somewhat of an addiction to the beef tacos here, but I tend to randomly roam from menu item to menu item as time goes by.You see I live literally next door to this restaurant, so it doubles as my kitchen.I eat here at least once a week, and sometimes significantly more.My complaint isn't about the food, but the fact that they fuck up my order nearly every time I go there.One would think after going to a certain restaurant at least once a week for a year they would start to know you and what you order.I guess not.All I ask for is a regular beef taco sans beans.I just don't want beans on my taco.Everything else is fine.It never fails that this simple request confuses the shit out of them.Sometimes they think that means I want nothing but beef.Sometimes they think that means beef and onions only.I know we are working with somewhat of a language barrier here, but the Thai place down the street never fucks up my order, and I can never understand what the fuck they are saying.Anyways I love this place and while sometimes inept their heart is in the right place.
author: Joshua T.

description: Everyone has their favorite Taqueria in the Mission, and mine is hands down El Buen Sabor. I admit that I've never ordered anything besides a super vegetarian burrito, but what a super vegetarian burrito it is.  The food always tastes and looks fresh and it's often busy which I take as a good sign.
