author: E. G.

description: I love the chile relleno burrito at El Buen Sabor.  Absolutely delicious; the best vegetarian burrito I've come across.
author: James S.

description: Burritos are good, but not the best in the Mission. Their burritos automatically come with lettuce and I hate that. Of course, I don't get it, but I still hate that they do it by default. Their burritos are kind of pricey too. From what I remember a super burrito came out to about $7. They do have a salsa bar though! And I do enjoy a good salsa bar.
author: Howie T.

description: It feels nice and mellow inside.  The ambiance is sunny and cheerful - and I personally love the pole and fan decorated to look like a palmtree! :-)  They're nice there, and polite, and they don't make me feel ashamed about my Spanish.  They're a LOT nicer than the people at El Toro, that's just obvious.  And they're patient.  I tend to alternate between the vegetarian burrito (rice, beans, cheese), the tofu burrito (rice, beans, tofu), and the red chicken burrito (rice, beans, and chicken in red sauce).  I loooooove the red sauce!  :-D  Been coming here for years and no plans of stopping now!
author: Yvea E.

description: my favorite burrito in san francisco. and i am from san diego where mexican food is the best in the world. it is definately a san francisco style burrito, however it is worthy of five stars.
author: Goober U.

description: i bring people here from out of town that are ignorant to the concept of taquerias. when they see how raw this place is they dont know what to think. and i dont think for people but i think that this place is dope. im more a taco head than into burritos and for 5-6$ you can be fuelled for hrs.
author: aidan m.

description: i usually get the super tofu burrito. the california veggie burrito is good. very reliable. my friend described her vegetarian burrito as the best burrito she'd ever had, and that she didn't want it to end.
author: Sara M.

description: the best veggie burrito in SF. plus their salsa rocks and their chips are fresh and crispy. For 5 years I lived two blocks from both El Buen Sabor and Cancun. I used to swear by Cancun, and then I flip-flopped. I don't live in the Mission anymore, but when I'm riding my bike through, I head straight to "the good flavor."
author: josh s.

description: agree that they stingy with the chips, but an an excellent al pastor taco here.  apparently i need to go back and try the veggie burrito.
author: James R.

description: Not fancy but the best taqueria in the city.   And the cleanest...98 points from the health inspector.  The taco salad rocks
author: sylvia s.

description: this being the closest to my house, i want so much to love it. or like it even. but somehow everything manages to be way too salty (and i'm a salt fiend so it takes a lot to say that) and simutaneously tasteless. its really weird.
author: Lily S.

description: My favorite misson district taqueria.  I think I've only had a carnitas taco, so I don't think I can fairly give it a five star rating, but that carnitas taco (the standard by which I judge taquerias) is the best by far that I've had in the mission.  The chips and table salsa are OK.
author: Corey B.

description: wicked pissa, one of the top 3 taquerias in the city.
author: nate C.

description: The al pastor is good, especially if you go early in the day when it's fresh.  However I am always a little perplexed by the guacamole, and why it must be so smooth.
author: Susie O.

description: Tasty carne asada burritos that reliably put me into a food coma most Sunday afternoons. If you get a quesadilla, consider splitting it with someone, as they are just too darn big for any one person to consume solo. Oh, and as a bonus, they have good chips here.
author: A. T.

description: rice was really soft and fluffy, pico sufficiently spiced and flavorful. burrito was freaking huge. i ordered one super taco and ended up with a massive mound of guac-smeared goodness on my plate.
author: Dana D.

description: i can't explain why their veggie burritos are better than all of the others in the hood but they are.  buen sabor includes all the same ingredients as the other mission taquerias but they come out a notch above.  the green salsa is also a perfect addition.  the only problem is that it's too close to my home for me to stick with my one-burrito/wk policy.
author: Megan K.

description: utterly delicious. i got the super burrito with carnitas AND beef, which the staff was happy to do. it tasted incredible. i'm already craving it again. very reasonably priced, no i'd even say it was cheap. 6 bucks for a really big burrito. all the food is cooked in front of you so you aren't worried about what you're getting. community style tables and benches with enough room to sit even on a sunday. try the green sauce on the table. it makes the meal!
author: theresa v.

description: this place has the most amazing tofu burrito i've ever had.  it's seriously awesome.  i used to live and work around the corner, and managed to eat at least one tofu burrito a day from this place (wasn't too good for my waistline though).  when i moved away from san francisco for 4 years, it was always my first stop when i came back to visit.  whenever i'm in the neighborhood now, i definitely stop by, and i've definitely converted many of my friends (even the non-vegetarian ones) from their purported favorite taquerias to this place.
author: L R.
